notes:
36-hole stroke play championship for senior men 
and 
women, with gross and net competitions. In addition 
to 
the overall championship, there are age divisions as 
follows: 55-59, 60-64, 65-69 and 70+.

title: Western Pennsylvania Mid-Amateur Championship
notes:
The Mid-Amateur Championship was started 
in 
1985 for amateur golfers residing in western 
Pennsylvania who are twenty-five years of 
age or 
older. The event is thirty-six holes of stroke 
play.

title: Western Pennsylvania Senior Amateur Championship
notes:
As many senior organizations began to form in the 
1920's, the first West Penn Senior Amateur was played 
in 1929. The 18-hole competition was changed to 36-
holes in 2000. The Senior Amateur is open to players 
age 55 and older with a Super-Senior Flight available 
to 
players 65 and older.

title: Western Pennsylvania Amateur Championship
notes:
Started in 1899 and played all but two 
years, 
1917-18, during World War I, the West 
Penn 
Amateur is one of the oldest regional 
championships in the country. The 54-hole 
tournament starts with a field of 78 
playing 36 
holes the first day, with a cut to the low 
32 
and ties (or within seven shots of the 
lead) for 
the second day. 18 holes of stroke play 
qualifying held at multiple sites for non-
exempt 
players prior to the championship.

title: Western Pennsylvania Brothers Tournament
notes:
First contested in 1950 in honor of  two 
brothers 
who had been killed in the World War II, 
the 
event has been held every year since 
inception 
at Shannopin Country Club and is 
traditionally 
held the first Friday in August. The 
championship 
is an 18-hole event, Chapman format, with 
at 
least one brother being a member of a 
WPGA 
Member Club.

title: Ida E. Dixon Cup
notes:
Open to players with handicap indexes up to 18.4. 
 
18 hole stroke play - Low Net and Low Gross will be 
awarded.

title: Mary Thayer Farnum Cup
notes:
36-holes stroke play, 18 holes each day.
 
This round of 36 holes and the qualifying round 
of 
the Women's Championship will determine the 
winner of the Silver Cross.
courseName: Union League Golf Club at Torresdale

title: Virginia Women's State Team Matches
notes:
Each club will enter three two-woman sides each 
day.  Each side of two will play an 18-hole qualifying 
round in a four-ball stroke play format.  The clubs 
with the four lowest aggregate scores will be placed 
in the Championship Flight.  All other clubs will be 
flighted by team handicap and seeded by aggregate 
qualifying score.  Team winners for each flight will 
be 
determined by two days of four-ball matches (one 
point per hole). Any VSGA Member Club or 
Association may enter a team of six female golfers 
who have belonged to that Club or Association since 
June 1 of the current year.
courseName: Wintergreen Resort - Devil's Knob Golf Course

title: West Virginia Senior Four-Ball Championship
notes:
Open to seniors affiliated with a WVGA member 
club. 
The competition is 36 holes of four-ball stroke play 
with 
Senior, Gold and Silver divisions.
courseName: Lakeview Golf Resort and Spa - Lakeview Course

title: Michigan Senior Championship
notes:
Must be a GAM member. 36-hole stroke play event 
for seniors (55 and older, 8.4 handicap max), and 
super 
seniors (65 and older, 10.4 handicap max).

title: Georgia Women's Four Ball Championship
notes:
The GWGA Four-Ball Tournament is a 36-hole 
tournament with net scoring, traditionally held 
annually 
at Jekyll 
Island. The tournament will be played on the 
Pine Lake and Indian Mounds courses. Each 
team 
consists of two GWGA members with a USGA 
handicap index of 23.2 or less.

title: Southern California Amateur Net Championship
notes:
This event gives all members an opportunity to 
compete in a major association tournament 
regardless 
of his/her handicap index level. Competitors 
compete 
over 18 holes of qualifying net stroke play to move 
on 
to the championship. A total of 180 players will 
qualify 
for the 36-hole Championship. The field is divided 
into 
flights of different handicap levels.

title: Hanna-Wehrman Cup Matches
notes:
The Hanna-Wehrman Cup features 10 amateur players representing the NCGA (top players from the previous season’s points list) taking on 10 professional players representing the Northern California PGA in a Ryder Cup-like format.

The first day of play consists of two rounds—one round of four-ball match play (better ball) and one round of foursome match play (alternate shot). The second day of play’s final rounds consist of singles match play.

title: Lake County Amateur Championship
notes:
36 hole stroke play championship, with Championship, 
Net, Senior, and Senior Net flights. Flights are 
determined by handicap or age: Championship 
handicaps of 9 or below, Net 10 and higher, Senior and 
Senior Net ages 50 and older.

title: Northern California Associate Club Championship
notes:
NCGA Associate Club members ONLY. Best two balls 
of 
four net. 18 hole local qualifying. 28 teams advance 
to 
the championship. Championship is 36 holes (18 
holes 
per day) played both at Spyglass Hill and Poppy 
Hills.

title: Napa City Amateur & Senior Championship
notes:
36 hole stroke play tournament with two flights: 
Championship and Senior (age 55+).

title: Shasta County Amateur Championship
notes:
NCGA points event. 36-hole stroke play event with 
Championship and net divisions played each 
September at Fall River Golf Course.
courseName: Fall River Valley Golf and Country Club

title: Southern California Tournament of Club Champions
notes:
Men’s club champions are invited to play in this 18-
hole event. The club 
champion must have a Handicap 
Index of 2.4 or below as of the date of registration. 
They must be an amateur member in good standing 
with the SCGA and a member on the club’s active 
SCGA roster at the time they won the championship. 
This Division will compete without handicaps. Men’s 
club champions with a Handicap Index of 2.5 and 
above will play in the net divisions.

title: Arizona Four-Ball Championship
notes:
Both participants must hold an active membership 
with 
an AGA Member Club. Maximum of 50 teams of 
2 for 36-holes four-ball stroke play at gross.

title: Arizona Senior Open Championship
notes:
The Arizona Senior Open is open to all professionals 
and amateurs that are at least 50 years of age. 
Amateurs must have a handicap index of 10.0 or 
less. 
Format is 36 holes of stroke play.

title: Phoenix City Championship
notes:
54 holes, played at three different area courses. 
Tournament is open to anyone with a handicap 
of 15.0 or less. Four flights based on handicap, all 
played at 
gross.

title: South Carolina Senior Amateur Championship
notes:
The SCGA Senior Championship is an opportunity for 
amateurs over the age of 55 years to gather and 
test 
their abilities against some of the best golfers and 
golf 
courses that South Carolina has to offer.

title: South Carolina Mid-Amateur Four-Ball Championship
notes:
The Mid Am Four Ball is what we call a "working 
man's" 
event with participants over the age of 30 partnering 
up with a teammate and playing a 36 hole Four Ball 
event.  The Mid Am Four Ball has historically been a 
very competitive event with a great atmosphere of 
fun 
and friendship.

title: South Carolina Senior Four-Ball Championship
notes:
The Senior Better Ball Championship is an opportunity for good friends to get together and enjoy a weekend of golf at one of the area's finest facilities - Santee Cooper Golf Club. With a better ball format and teams broken into flights after the first round, competition is available at all levels of ability.

A 10:00 AM shotgun start on both days also means that participants won't be spending their entire day on the golf course. Come join us in one of the longest running Senior events in the SCGA Championship series.

title: South Carolina Players Four-Ball Championship
notes:
One of the most popular events that the SCGA conducts is the Players Four Ball Championship historically competed at Columbia Country Club. Played over a weekend in September, this event has become a favorite event for the players.

With the field broken into flights after the first round, participants of all abilities can come enjoy and still compete against other teams of the same caliber. The atmosphere at the Players Four Ball is not only highly competitive, but thrives on the social aspect.

title: South Carolina Mid-Amateur Championship
notes:
What has become known as the "Working Man's" 
tournament, this Championship is for individuals 
25 
years of age and older.  A 54 hole event that is 
cut to 
the low 60 and ties for the final round, the Mid 
Amateur 
Championship has become a true test for the true 
amateur golfer.

title: North Carolina Mid-Amateur Championship
notes:
North Carolina Mid-Amateur Championship is open 
to 
any male amateur golfer who has reached his 30th 
birthday, is a legal resident of North Carolina, is a 
member in good standing of a club which is a 
member of the Carolinas Golf Association (CGA) and 
has an active GHIN® USGA Handicap Index® at a 
CGA member club that does not exceed 5.4. 
Sectional qualifying is required in the weeks before 
the championship unless exemption criteria is met. 
54-hole stroke play event with a cut to the low 60 
and ties after 36 holes.
courseName: Lonnie Poole Golf Course at NC State

title: Carolinas Senior Amateur Championship
notes:
The Carolinas Senior Amateur Championship is a 
54-hole stroke play event open to any male 
amateur golfer who reached his 55th birthday by 
today, is a legal resident of North Carolina or 
South Carolina, is a member in good standing of 
a 
club which is a member of the Carolinas Golf 
Association and has an active USGA Handicap 
Index® at a CGA member club that does not 
exceed 10.4.

title: Nevada State Match Play Championship
notes:
Match play championship open to male members of the 
SNGA and NNGA. 18 holes of stroke play qualifying 
determines 16 
players 
for single-elimination match play.
courseName: The Golf Club at Genoa Lakes

title: Mississippi Senior Amateur Championship
notes:
Tournament is scheduled for 54 holes of stroke play; players will be flighted after 36 holes of play within their age division. Field size is limited to the first 104 players.

The Championship is open to male amateurs who are bona fide residents of the state of Mississippi for at least 60 days prior to the first round of the tournament.

Divisions:
- Seniors must have reached their 50th birthday prior to the first day of the championship.
- Super Seniors must have reached their 60th birthday prior to the first day of the championship.
- Grand Masters must have reached their 70th birthday prior to the first day of the championship.

title: John Bryan Cup Team Championship
notes:
Field size is limited to the first 16 paid teams. The tournament is scheduled for 36-holes of college tournament format. Each team will use the four lowest scores of the five players each day for the team total.

Open to all MGA member clubs in good standing. All team members must be a regular member of the course/club they are representing. Because of the limited field a club may only send one team.

title: Heart of America Four-Ball Championship
notes:
Stroke play qualifying with low (32 
championship and 16 senior teams) advancing to 
match play.  Open to any male amateur golfer 
with an active 
USGA handicap index.  Championship teams 
combined index must be 10.0 or less.  Senior 
teams combined index must be 14.0 or less.

title: Philadelphia Open Championship
notes:
Format: 36-hole individual gross stroke play, two day event. With a cut after the first day to the low 60 and ties.

Eligibility: The field will consist of professionals who are active members of the Philadelphia Section PGA in good standing (the A-4 classification is not eligible), Head Professionals of GAP Member Clubs, Assistant Professionals of member clubs who are active members of the New Jersey Section PGA and amateurs who are members of member clubs and have handicap index of 7.0 or less. Non-exempt players must prequalify.

title: Philadelphia Senior Amateur Championship
notes:
Format: 36-hole individual stroke play over two days.

Eligibility: Open to GAP Member Club golfers who are 55 years of age and over as of the first day of the championship. Players must have a handicap index of 7.0 or lower, super-senior 7.0 or lower handicap index. A Super Senior (65 years of age and older) may play in the "Senior tournament," play to be from the Senior tees.

title: Philadelphia Four-Ball Stroke Play Championship
notes:
Format: Better Ball of Partners. 18-hole gross and net four-ball stroke play. Strokes for net scores will be calculated at 90 percent of the course handicap. Additionally the maximum handicap index for any player is 18.0. If a side has a difference of more than eight strokes (after allowance) in Course Handicap an additional 10 percent reduction will be applied to the Course Handicap of each member of the team.

Eligibility: Players must be members of Member Clubs with an 18.0 handicap index or less. Partners need not be members of the same club.

title: Philadelphia Tournament of Champions
notes:
Format: Eighteen hole individual gross stoke play.

Eligibility: Current GAP Member Club amateur champions, senior champions, super-senior club champions and previous winners of the event. Senior Champions must be 50 years of age or older, Super Senior Champions must be 65 years of age or older.

title: Golf Association of Michigan Women's Senior Championship
notes:
Open to seniors (50+) who are members of GAM. 
Format is 36-holes of stroke play with flighted 
divisions 
and net and gross champions.

title: Delaware Senior Amateur Championship
notes:
36-hole flighted stroke play championship for men 
aged 
55 and over, and for women aged 50 and over.

title: Delaware Fall Classic
notes:
Format: "Best Selected 18". 36 Holes of four ball stroke play. The lowest score, on each hole, of either partner on either day will be added to determine the team score.

90% handicap allowed per player. Flights will be established based on team handicap: 1/2 of higher handicap index + lower handicap index.
courseName: Cripple Creek Golf and Country Club

title: Minnesota Amateur Net Team Championship
notes:
The MGA Team Championship includes four-person 
teams which are divided into two 2-person squads. 
The 
format is 36 holes with the 
low score of each squad on each hole combined.
courseName: The Preserve at Grand View Lodge

title: Utah Senior Stroke Play Championship
notes:
Format: 54 holes stroke play for the Gross Division with a cut to the low 40 & ties after the second round. All remaining flights will be 36 holes of stroke play.

Flight Information: The tournament will have a Gross Division (age 50-64, gross only), a Super-Senior Division (65 and older, gross only) and a Net Division (age 50 and older, net only.) A player over the age of 65 may choose to compete in the overall championship but will be required to play the championship tees and will forfeit their eligibility in the super-senior division.

Eligibility: All UGA members who are 50 years of age or older as of the first day of competition are eligible to compete.

title: Northern California Mid-Amateur Four-Ball Championship
notes:
Two-person, better-ball scratch event for NCGA 
members 25 years of age and older. FORMAT: 36 
holes of four-ball stroke play, 18 holes per day.
ELIGIBILITY: Players must have reached their 
25th 
birthday by the start of the tournament and 
have a numeric handicap index listed on their 
club’s 
Master Report of 5.4 or less on the date of 
registration. Partners need not be members of the 
same club.

title: Southern California Senior Amateur Championship
notes:
This event is open to members with handicap 
indexes 
of 9.4 and below and are age 55 and above. 
Competitors compete in 18 holes of qualifying play 
in 
order to reach the final field of 84 players. In the 
championship, players compete over 54 holes of 
stroke 
play over three days. The top 30 players and ties 
advance after 36 holes to the final round to 
determine 
the overall Senior Amateur Champion.

title: Colorado Four-Ball Championship
notes:
54 holes of Four-Ball stroke play at scratch for 
members of the Colorado Golf Association.

title: Colorado Senior Amateur Championship
notes:
Active CGA members ages 50 and up. 54 holes of 
stroke play. A 36-hole cut will be 
made to the low 40 players and ties. 
Non-exempt players must pre-qualify.

title: Colorado Mid-Amateur Championship
notes:
Active CGA members. 54 holes of stroke play. A 36-
hole cut will be made to the low 40 players and ties. 
A 
player must be 25 years of age or older 
as 
of the first day of a tournament. Non-exempt 
players 
must pre-qualify.

title: Oregon Mid-Amateur Championship
notes:
ELIGIBILITY

WOMEN: Entries are open to female amateur golfers with USGA Handicap Indexes™ of 22.4 or less. The field will be limited to the 21 entrants with the lowest USGA Handicap Indexes at the entry deadline. In the event that the Women’s Division does not reach its field limit, the remaining spots will be transferred to the Men’s Division.

MEN: Entries are open to amateur golfers with USGA Handicap Indexes™ of 10.0 or less. The final Championship field will include exempt players as well as those that advance from the additional 18-hole stroke play qualifying stage.

All contestants must be members in good standing of an OGA Member Club and be at least 25 years of age.

36-hole stroke play competition. Prize awards will be made on the basis of gross finish.

title: Michigan Mid-Amateur Championship
notes:
36-hole stroke play championship contested over 
two days. Open to men, 25 and older; flights include 
Mid-Am (5.4 hdcp max), Mid-Senior (8.4 hdcp max), 
Seniors (10.4 hdcp max), and Super Seniors (10.4 
hdcp max).

title: Georgia Four-Ball Championship
notes:
Entries: Open to two-man teams of male amateur golfers

Field: 80 teams with the lowest combined USGA Handicap Indexes

Format: 54 holes of four-ball stroke play; field cut to the low 40 teams and ties after 36 holes

title: Georgia Mid-Amateur Championship
notes:
Entries: Open to male amateur golfers age 25 or older as of the first day of the championship

Field: 144 players; non-exempt players enter through one of seven statewide 18-hole qualifiers

Format: 54 holes of stroke play; field cut to the low 70 and ties after 36 holes

title: Georgia Public Links Championship
notes:
Entries: Open to male amateur golfers who are members of a GSGA Member Club that is open to public play. Entrants must not have held privileges since January 1 of the current year at any club that does not permit public play.

Field: 72 players with the lowest USGA Handicap Indexes and 72 drawn by lottery; three exemptions are given to the host club

Format: 36 holes of flighted stroke play.
courseName: Chateau Elan Resort - Chateau Elan Course

title: Florida Senior Amateur Championship
notes:
The Senior Championship is for those individuals 
over the age of 55. 54 holes of stroke play, with a 
cut 
to the low 60 and ties after 36 holes. Must be an 
FSGA 
member.

title: Florida Amateur Championship
notes:
Started in 1914, the Amateur Championship is 
the oldest continuous sporting event in the 
state of Florida. The field will include exempt 
players and players who have qualified 
through 
18 holes of stroke play at one of the qualifying sites. 
The Championship features a field of 168 
players split alternately on two golf courses 
the first two days. The field is reduced to the 
low 70 and ties after the first two rounds to 
play an additional 36 holes of stroke play.

title: Florida Senior Four-Ball Championship
notes:
36-hole four-ball stroke play championship. Players 
must be age 55 or older, 
and both entrants must be members of the 
FSGA.
FLIGHTS:  After 18 holes. The number of 
flights in each age division will be based 
on the number of teams and/or the range 
of scores.

title: Tennessee Senior & Super Senior Amateur Championship
notes:
54 hole stroke play championship. A cut of the low 
30 
Senior scores and ties will be made 
following the 2nd round. A cut of the low 15 Super 
Sr 
scores and ties will be made following 
the 2nd round. Applications are open to amateurs 
who 
possess an active USGA/GHIN
Handicap Index of 10.0 or less from a TGA member 
club or course.
courseName: Tennessee Grasslands Golf and Country Club (Foxland Links)

title: Tennessee Mid-Amateur Championship
notes:
Open to amateurs age 25 and older who are 
members 
of a TGA Club. Qualifying is required for those 
who 
do 
not meet the exemption criteria. Format consists 
of 
54 
holes of stroke play with a cut to the low 30 
players 
and ties following the second round.

title: Idaho Mid-Amateur Championship
notes:
Stroke play championship for men and women mid-
amateurs; men play 54 holes and women play 36 
holes. Entries are open to amateur golfers who must 
have an up-to-date USGA Handicap Index®. A 
Handicap Index must either be issued from an IGA 
District I, II, or III member “golf club” (as defined in 
the “USGA Handicap System Manual”) which is 
licensed to use the USGA Handicap SystemTM . Or, 
for bona fide residents of the State of Idaho, 
Panhandle District have an up-to-date USGA 
Handicap Index® issued from a WSGA licensed 
member “golf club.”

title: West Virginia Mid-Amateur Championship
notes:
Entries are open to male amateur golfers with an 
active GHIN Handicap index through a WVGA 
Member 
Club, and who are 25 years of age or older by the 
first 
round of Championship. The championship will be 18 
holes of stroke play qualifying followed by match 
play 
with the field being cut to the low 32 players.

title: Pennsylvania Senior Four-Ball Championship
notes:
The Senior Four-Ball Championship was separated 
from the Four-Ball 
Championship in 2005 to allow more Senior 
Amateurs the chance to 
compete in this event. 36-hole four-ball stroke play 
competition open to 
any 
male amateur golfer 55 years of age and over who is 
a 
member of the Pennsylvania Golf Association. The 
Championship will 
also have a Super-Senior Division for a team with 
both members age 65 
and over. Teams may ONLY play in the Senior Four-
Ball or The Super-
Senior Four-Ball, NOT both.

title: Pennsylvania Mid-Amateur Championship
notes:
36-hole stroke play event open to open to any male 
amateur golfer who is a member of a club belonging 
to 
the Pennsylvania Golf Association and is 25 years of 
age or older. Qualifying is required for those who do 
not meet the exemption criteria.

title: Philadelphia Senior 27-Hole Challenge
notes:
Format: Three gross Nine-hole stipulated rounds consisting of the first nine being four-ball stoke play, the second nine being aggregate and the last nine is selective drive – alternate shot. There will be two divisions Super Senior (both players 65 years and older) and Championship. The Super Senior division will play from a shorter set of tee markers.

Eligibility: Open to senior male golfers, fifty-five years of age and over, who are members of Member Clubs with a 18.0 or less handicap index.

title: Oklahoma Four-Ball Championship
notes:
Open to pairs of amateurs who are residents of 
Oklahoma and members of the OGA. Format is 36-
holes of four-ball stroke play.

title: The Vandersluis Memorial
notes:
The Vandersluis Memorial Golf Tournament is held each year at the Bemidji Town & Country Club over Labor Day Weekend. The event has an international field with divisions for Men, Senior Men and Ladies. Past men's champions (including 1996 British Open Champion Tom Lehman) have gone on to successful professional and amateur careers. The format provides top competition for players of all ability.

There are 6 different divisions that players can enter:
• Mens Champs- Open to men of all ages
• Sr. Men's Champ-Open to men age 50 and over
• Master's Champ-Open to men age 65 and over
• Men's Regular flight-Open to men age 19 and over
• Sr Men's Regular flight-Open to men age 50 and over
• Ladies Regular flight-Open to ladies age 19 and over

title: Colorado Parent-Child Championship
notes:
Parent/Child is open to male and female participants who are CGA or CWGA members or members of the Colorado Section of the PGA. The Parent/Child relationship must be a blood or legal relationship (no in-laws). A player can only play on one team. Teams can consist of mother/daughter, mother/son, father/son or father/daughter. Grandparents may play with their grandchild.

36-holes, competing at both gross and net at 50% of the players’ combined handicap for both days. First round is 18 holes Chapman Scotch. The second round is 18 holes Foursome Stroke Play.

title: Utah-Arizona Shootout
notes:
The Utah Golf Association and the Arizona Golf 
Association began this team Ryder Cup style 
event 
in 
1991 to showcase the top amateur golfers in both 
states and to build camaraderie amongst the 
players.

title: Las Vegas Senior City Amateur Championship
notes:
Format is 36 holes stroke play with Senior (ages 51+), 
and Silver (ages 61+) divisions, with gross and net 
prizes. Field is 
limited to 80 entries. All competitors must be an active 
member of the Southern Nevada Golf Association.

title: Las Vegas City Amateur Championship
notes:
36-hole stroke play event with championship and 
net 
divisions limited to 110 players. Minimum age 15 
although younger players can email playing resume for 
consideration. Competitors 
must be an active member of the Southern Nevada 
Golf Association.

title: Clark County Senior Amateur Championship
notes:
Format is 36 holes stroke play with Senior, Senior Net, 
Silver and Silver Net divisions. Field is limited to the 
first 80 entries. All competitors must be an active 
member of the Southern Nevada Golf Association.

title: Clark County Amateur Championship
notes:
36-hole stroke play event with championship and net 
divisions limited to the first 52 entries. Competitors 
must be an active member of the Southern Nevada Golf 
Association.

title: Staedler-Jetter Senior Cup Matches
notes:
The Staedler-Jetter Cup features 14 amateur players ages 55-over (10 Seniors and four Super Seniors) representing the NCGA (top players from the previous season’s points list) taking on 14 professional players ages 55-over representing the Northern California PGA in a Ryder Cup-like format.

The first day of play consists of two rounds—one round of four-ball match play (better ball) and one round of foursome match play (alternate shot). The second day of play’s final rounds consist of singles match play.

title: Northern California Team Match Championship
notes:
Participating clubs with 12 players per team compete 
in matches during the summer with the top teams 
from each region advancing to the Championship at 
Poppy Hills. Format is as follows: A team of two players 
plays the opposing team of two, playing three matches 
simultaneously - two individual matches and a four-ball 
match.

title: Northern California Fall Mixed Team Championship
notes:
First played in 2005, the NCGA Mixed Championship is a two-person handicap event for male/female NCGA members. It is contested in three flights divided by handicap index: President 0-11, Director 12-17 and Secretary 18 and above.

Open to any male/female team. No players under 18 years of age. Both players must be NCGA Members and have a current numeric handicap index on their club’s Master Report on the date of registration. Partners need not be members of the same club.

The championship will be 36 holes of stroke play (18 holes per day) in a Mixed Chapman format. Play will be 60% of the lower course handicap and 40% of the higher course handicap.

title: Florida Women's Senior Amateur Championship
notes:
Championship Format
- 36 holes of individual stroke play
- 84 total competitors
- Four Divisions - Senior Championship, Senior Field, Super-Senior Championship and Super-Senior Field Division.
- Players must select their division at the time of entry, provided they meet the eligibility requirements.
- The overall Champions will be the individuals from the Senior and Super-Senior Championship Divisions with the lowest 36-hole total score.

Eligibility
- Female amateur golfer
- At least 50 years of age as of the first day of the Championship
- At least 65 years of age as of the first day of the Championship to select to play in the Super-Senior Division at time of entry
- A valid Florida GHIN Handicap Index not exceeding 34.0
- Entrant is required to be a member of the FSGA

title: Arizona Women's Partners Tournament
notes:
This tournament shall consist of Day 1 - 18 holes to be played under Rule 31, Four-Ball Stroke Play and Day 2 - 18 holes of individual stroke play with aggregate score of partners. Scoring for both rounds will be a modified stableford.

Day 1- Each partner receives 95% of her course handicap. Course handicap, after allowance, of the members of a side may not differ by more than eight strokes. Day 2- Each partner receives 100% of her course handicap.

Prizes will be awarded to the Overall Team Champions along with gross and net team flight prizes.
courseName: Ventana Canyon Golf Club - Mountain Course

title: Arizona Women's State Senior Championship
notes:
The Championship shall consist of 54 holes of stroke play. The tournament is open to senior women amateur golfers (age 50 and older) who have a USGA Handicap Index of 40.4 or lower and are AGA members in good standing for at least 30 days prior to the first day of the tournament.

The flights will be: 1. Championship Flight 2. Field Flights 3. Super Seniors (70 – 74 Years old) 4. Masters (75 - 79 Years old) 5. Legends (80+ Years old)

1) The Mary Lou Sauer Memorial Trophy is a team combined net trophy for the field flights. 2) The Mo Cruikshank Memorial Trophy is a team combined gross trophy for the Championship flight. 3) The Dr. Ann PIttman Memorial Trophy is a team combined net trophy for the Super Seniors flight. 4) The Legends Championship Trophy shall be awarded to the lowest gross scorer of the Masters and Legends Divisions combined. 5) The Legends Net Championship Trophy will be awarded for the Masters and Legends Divisions combined.

title: Palm Beach Stableford
notes:
Individual Modified Stableford for 36 Holes. 
Competitors lose 1 point for a Double 
Bogey or worse. 1 point for Bogey, 2 points 
for Par, 4 points for Birdie, 6 points for 
Eagle, 8 points for 
Double Eagle.  Open to all PBCGA 
Members. Open, Senior and Super Senior divisions. 
Maximum handicap 
allowed 
is 18.
courseName: PGA National Golf Club - Estates Course

title: Palm Beach County Senior Amateur Championship
notes:
Format is 36-holes of stroke play with Senior (50-
59), 
Super Senior (60-69), and Legend (70+) divisions.  
Open to all PBCGA members who have reached their 
50th 
birthday by the start of the tournament.

title: Birmingham National Invitational
notes:
This 54-hole stroke play event, traditionally held 
the weekend after Memorial Day, dates back to 
the early 1900's and has "Vintage" division 
for seniors with special accomplishments.
courseName: Country Club of Birmingham - West Course

title: Clay Dykes Senior Invitational - CANCELLED
notes:
**Cancelled due to the coronavirus outbreak.

Four Ball Invitational honors a charter member of The Farm, which hosted the 2005 U.S. Senior Amateur and currently hosts the Carpet Capital Intercollegiate.

title: Anderson Memorial Four-Ball - CANCELLED
notes:
**Due to hosting the U.S. Open, the Anderson Memorial, which had moved to September due to COVID-19, has been cancelled.

Perhaps the most coveted best-ball invitation in all of amateur golf. Created in 1933 to honor Winged Foot founding member and two time U.S. Amateur runner-up John G. Anderson, the event consists of a 36 hole qualifier followed by two days of match play competition in both Championship and Senior divisions.
courseName: Winged Foot Golf Club - West Course

title: Senior Azalea Invitational - CANCELLED
notes:
**Cancelled due to the coronavirus outbreak.

54 hole stroke play on a 1925 Seth Raynor design. Senior (ages 55+) and super senior (ages 65+) divisions.

title: International Seniors Summer Championship
notes:
The Society conducts two championships per year: a Summer Championship and a Mid-Winter Championship. The championships are conducted over 72 holes and are played in three divisions:

Championship (Scratch)
Age 65+ Championship (Scratch)
Stableford (Par points)
Super Seniors - 70 years and older (Stableford)

title: Society of Seniors Ralph Bogart Tournament
notes:
54-hole stroke play event open to members of the 
Society of Seniors Golf Association. There will be 
senior (ages 55+), super senior (65+) and grand 
master (70+) divisions.

title: Massachusetts Father-Daughter Championship
notes:
Entries are open to any Father and Daughter
team who are both members of an MGA
member club. A father may only play one
round, with one daughter, in the Championship.  
Competition will be 18 Holes at Foursomes
Stroke Play (selected drive). The field is limited
to 50 teams.

title: Massachusetts Mid-Amateur Championship
notes:
Entries are open to amateur golfers who 
have
reached their 25th birthday by the first 
day of 
the tournament,
who hold membership in an MGA member 
club
and have an up-to-date MGA/USGA GHIN
Handicap Index not exceeding 5.4, or
who have completed their handicap 
certification
as defined on the Entry Form.  
Competition will 
be in two (2) stages
at Stroke Play: 18 hole qualifier; 
Championship 
Proper - 54 Holes.

title: Massachusetts Senior Amateur Championship
notes:
Entries are open to amateur golfers who hold
membership in an MGA member club, who
have reached their 55th birthday by
the first day of the tournament and have an 
up-
to-date
MGA/USGA GHIN Handicap Index not 
exceeding
8.0 or have completed
their handicap certification as defined on the
Entry Form. Competition will be 36 Holes 
at 
Stroke Play.

title: Kentucky Challenge Cup
notes:
Team matches between the Kentucky Golf Association and the Kentucky PGA. This event is currently on a three site rotation including three of the most prestigious golf venues in the Commonwealth; Idle Hour Country Club, Valhalla Golf Club and The Club @ Olde Stone. Since its establishment in the 1970’s, Kentucky’s finest amateur and professional golfers have gone head to head to retain or regain the “Cup”.

Teams from the KGA and the KPGA are now composed of 12 members chosen by the use of the past year’s Player of the Year standings. Team captains will continue using their two at- large selections after the initial 10 players have been confirmed.

The team and individual match play format will use 27 holes. The first 9 hole – Four-Ball Team, Second 9 holes – Alternate Shot Team and the third 9 holes – Singles Match Play.

title: Kentucky Mid-Amateur Championship
notes:
36-hole stroke play championship with the following divisions: Open (ages 25+), Mid-Senior (40-49), Senior (50-59), and Masters (60+). Open division is gross scoring only, while the other divisions are gross and net.

Entrants in all KGA tournaments shall be required to have an active Handicap Index at a Kentucky Golf Association Member Club at the time of entry and meet the championship’s residency requirements.

title: Delaware 27-Hole Challenge
notes:
27-hole flighted stroke play tournament open to 
male 
amateur golfers. Format: Nine (9) hole scramble, nine 
(9) hole alternate shot, nine (9) hole four-ball.

title: New Hampshire Senior Championship
notes:
Tournament is 36 holes stroke play, gross, 
in four age divisions: 55-62, 63-69, 70-74, 
75 and up.  All gross division players will 
play from back tees. Any tie for overall first 
will be played off at sudden death stroke 
play after regular play has finished.
Entries are open to male members of 
member NHGA Clubs who are legal 
residents of New Hampshire.  Applicants 
must be 55 years of age.

title: New Hampshire Mid-Amateur Championship
notes:
The tournament will consist of 54 holes 
stroke 
play with a cut for Saturday to low 27 
players 
and ties. Entries are 
open to male members in good standing 
of 
member NHGA Clubs who are legal 
residents of 
New Hampshire. Applicants must be 30 
years 
of age by the first day of the tournament.

title: Women's Southern Senior Championship
notes:
The WSGA Senior Championship is a 54 hole 
stroke play event. The field is divided into flights 
after 36 holes of play.

title: Midwest Amateur Championship
notes:
36-hole stroke play event at Sydney Marovitz Golf 
Course in Chicago. First played in the 1920s. Run by 
the Chicago Park District.

title: Chicago International Championship
notes:
Modified Stableford Scoring System. 36-hole 
tournament played at Robert Black Golf Course in 
Chicago. Run by the Chicago Park District.

title: Oceanside City Senior Amateur Championship
notes:
One of the older City Amateur Championships in 
Southern California.  36 hole Stroke Play with 
Senior flights (50-59 & 60-69) and a Super Senior flight 
(70&up). Gross and Net prizes. Participants must have 
a valid SCGA or USGA 
handicap.

title: New Jersey Men's Public Links Championship
notes:
The Championship will be 36-Holes, Stroke-Play. The 
Champion will be the player with the lowest 36 hole 
aggregate
score. The starting field will consist of 40 players, 
plus ties, from the three qualifying sites and
those exempt from qualifying.  Entrant must be a 
permanent resident of New Jersey and must NOT 
hold playing privileges, incidental or otherwise, at 
any facility which is not
open to the general public.

title: Washington Senior & Super Senior Men's Amateur Championship
notes:
54-hole gross stroke play competition (overall 
and by age division). Senior Division 55 years of 
age or older. Super Senior Division 65 years of 
age or older.

title: Santa Barbara County Championship
notes:
La Purisima Golf Course is the host of the 
Santa Barbara County Championship. This 
36 
hole amateur  event typically boasts a 
large 
number of entries in the Championship 
Flight 
but also fields a Handicap Flight. Located 
15 
minutes west of Hwy 101 just outside of 
Lompoc, California, La Purisima is known 
for its 
fair but rigorous test of pure golf that has 
challenged PGA Tour Qualifiers and earned 
a 
spot on Golf Magazine's Top 100 Places to 
Play 
in the United States. It is the only course 
in 
California between Monterrey and Simi 
Valley 
to be named to this prestigious list.

title: Florida Cup Challenge Matches
notes:
Held every two years, the Florida Cup 
Matches vie 16 of the top amateurs from 
North Florida versus 16 of the top 
amateurs from South Florida. Using a 
Ryder-Cup format, the winner is 
determined by the number of points 
earned throughout the two days. Players 
are invited based on their performance 
from the previous two seasons. Some 
automatic selections are based on the 
FSGA two-year point's standings.

title: Women's World Amateur Team Golf Championship (Espirito Santo Trophy) - CANCELLED
notes:
**Cancelled due to the coronavirus outbreak.

In 1958 the United States Golf Association asked The R&A to join them in sponsoring a world-wide amateur golf team event to be played biennially in non-Walker Cup years. Between 35 and 40 nations were represented at the first meeting and President Dwight D. Eisenhower presented the trophy which bears his name. The committee of the event was to be known as the World Amateur Golf Council and is now the International Golf Federation. Teams of four players from each country competed over 72 holes with the leading three scores from each round to count. The first competition was held between 29 nations at St Andrews, with Australia beating the United States in a play-off. In 2002 the format changed to teams of three with the two leading scores to count.

title: British Women's Amateur Championship
notes:
**For 2020, the starting field will be 100 players, from which exactly 64 players will advance to match play using a card count back to break ties.

This championship, along with the US Women’s Amateur Golf Championship, is considered the most important in women’s amateur golf.

The first stage of the Championship involves 144 players each of whom plays two rounds of 18 holes. The 64 lowest scores over the 36 holes will compete in the match play stage of the Championship. Each match will consist of one round of 18 holes, including the Final.

The ‘Pam Barton Memorial Salver’ is awarded to the winner of the Championship, while the runner- up receives The Diana Fishwick Cup. An international team award is presented after the stroke play qualifying rounds.

title: Texas Shootout
notes:
This Ryder Cup-style team event is the final tournament of the Texas Golf Association competitive amateur golf season. Each team consists of 8 players who qualify for their respective teams via TGA State and Regional Player of the Year points accumulated throughout the TGA season.

Eligibility: The field will be made up of 16 competitors, 8 players from each region (North / South). Of the 8 players chosen from each region, 5 players will be selected from the TGA Statewide Player of the Year point standings, and 3 players will be selected from the TGA Regional Player of the Year point standings. All statewide players will have up to the completion of the current year USGA Mid Amateur Championship to earn points toward the event. All Regional players will have up to the completion of the Regional Mid Amateur Championship to earn points towards the event. If a player qualifies by both criteria, he will be selected based on the higher rank. The next highest ranked player from within the Regional or Statewide points will be added to ensure 5 players from the statewide rankings and three players from the Regional rankings will be chosen.

Format: Ryder Cup format: Four-ball Matches, Foursome (Alternate shot) Matches, and Singles Matches. 3 point system, 1 point for the winner of each nine holes, and 1 point for the overall match winner
courseName: The Traditions Club at Texas A&M

title: Dennis Ewing Cup
notes:
54-hole four-ball invitational held at Dallas Athletic 
Club, a private club with a long and noble golf 
history that includes hosting the 1963 PGA (won by 
a 
then 21-year-old Jack Nicklaus). Jack returned to 
DAC in 1985 and 1988 to redesign both courses, and 
was also consulted on the latest course update in 
2011. The 
club has also hosted many amateur championships
including the Texas State Amateur and the USGA 
Mid-Amateur. Entries 
are limited to Mid-Amateur teams (Age 25-50) and 
Senior Teams (Age 50+).

title: The Hannon Cup Matches
notes:
Ryder Cup style team event between Central Texas 
amateurs and professionals. The event honors George 
Hannon, the long-time coach of the University of Texas 
whose players included Ben Crenshaw, Tom Kite, Phil 
Blackmar, Mark Brooks, and Brandel Chamblee.

title: Greater Houston City Amateur Championship
notes:
72-hole stroke play championship, run by the 
Houston 
Golf Association that many people consider 
Houston's 
"Major" (with the feel of a PGA Tour event, 
including a 
cut to the low 40 and ties). Players must have 
permanent residency in the Greater Houston area 
which includes the following counties: Brazoria, 
Chambers, Fort Bend, Galveston, Harris, Liberty, 
Montgomery and Waller. Non-exempt players must 
pre-qualify.

title: Firecracker Open Golf Championship - POSTPONED
notes:
**Postponed due to the coronavirus outbreak.

54-hole individual stroke play tournament that draws a strong local and college field. Past winners include Tom Kite, Ben Crenshaw, and Omar Uresti. Qualifying tournaments are held prior to the event. A putting tournament is typically held after the first round, with 32 two-person teams playing nine- hole best ball matches.

title: Austin Senior City Championship - POSTPONED
notes:
**Postponed due to the coronavirus outbreak.

36 hole stroke play senior event held at one of the oldest and most historic city courses in Austin. Senior and Super Senior divisions.

title: Greater Houston Senior City Amateur Championship
notes:
54-hole stroke play tournament with senior and 
super-senior 
divisions. Players must have permanent residency 
in 
the Greater Houston area which includes the 
following 
counties: Brazoria, Chambers, Fort Bend, 
Galveston, 
Harris, Liberty, Montgomery and Waller.

title: Dallas City Championship
notes:
36 hole stroke play tournament with the following 
divisions: Men's Championship Flight (handicaps of 5 or 
below), Men's Net Flights (handicaps above 5; flights 
determined by handicap), Men's Senior Flight, Women's 
Championship

title: Fort Worth Men's City Championship
notes:
36-hole individual stroke play championship, 
flighted by handicap. Open to male golfers age 18 
and 
over by date of event, with a verifiable USGA 
handicap. Collegiate golf team 
members are not eligible.

title: Sunnehanna Senior Invitational
notes:
54-holes stroke play with Senior (ages 55+), super 
senior (65+) and legends (70+) divisions. Played on 
a 
classic A.W. Tillinghast design. Traditional dates are 
the 
Monday through Wednesday after Labor Day but the 
2020 dates will be a one year trial.

title: Society of Seniors Dale Morey Championship
notes:
54 hole stroke play event that honors one of the 
founders of the SOS, Dale Morey, who won more 
than 250 events in a lifetime of golf. There is 
also 
a John Owens division and Grand Masters 
Division 
held simultaneously. SOS annual meeting and 
banquet is held with this tournament.

title: Texas Senior Open Championship
notes:
54-hole stroke play event open to pros and 
amateurs who are at 
least 50 years of age by the first day of the 
tournament. Senior (ages 50-64) and Super Senior 
(65+) divisions. Women play in the same division but 
at a distance that is 80-85%.

title: Nevada Open Golf Championship
notes:
The Nevada Open is a 54 hole event with a cut after 36 holes. Each player will play one round at the Palms and CasaBlanca Golf Clubs before the 36 hole cut. The cut will take place at 30% of the field plus ties.

Amateurs will be taken into the event by application. Fill out the online application for amateurs and you will be contacted if you are in the field. Only a limited amount of amateurs will be taken into the event. Amateurs may not have a handicap over 4 to compete in the Nevada Open.

title: Kansas Senior Series Championship
notes:
36 holes stroke play with two age divisions:

Age 50 to 64 - (gross & net scoring)
Age 65 & Over - (gross & net scoring)

Eligibility: By Invitation Only. Invitation based on player performance during 20 regular season KGA Senior Series events.

title: High Plains Amateur Championship
notes:
Format: 36 Holes of stroke play with Open, Masters and Senior divisions.

Eligibility: Members of the Colorado, Kansas, Sun Country Golf Association who have an officially verified USGA handicap index.

title: Iowa Four-Ball Championship
notes:
36-hole four-ball stroke play championship with 
Open 
and Senior (50+) divisions. Must be a member of an 
IGA Member Club.

title: American Seniors Stroke Play Championship
notes:
54 hole Gross, Net and Stableford competition 
open to men and women of the American Seniors 
Golf 
Association.

title: Holston Hills Invitational
notes:
36-hole stroke play invitational at a classic and 
wonderfully preserved Donald Ross course. Four 
divisions: Championship Flight, Senior Flight, and 
regular flights for Championship and Senior. 
Tennessee 
Golf Association Player of the Year points event.

title: South Dakota SODAK Cup
notes:
This team event matches ten of the top amateur 
golfers 
in the state against ten PGA professionals from 
SDGA 
member clubs.

title: Texas Women's Senior Stroke Play Championship
notes:
Eligibility: Entries are open to female amateur golfers with a certified GHIN Handicap Index, and who are 50 years of age or older by the first round of the Championship.

Player Field: The starting field will consist of 96 players. In the event the championship becomes over-subscribed, entries will be accepted in order of handicap index.

Format: The championship will be a 54 hole stroke play championship. Upon completion of Round 2, the field will be broken into flights based on 36-hole scores.

title: Santa Barbara Senior Open Championship
notes:
36 hole individual stroke play tournament open to all 
men and women 50 years of age and older. There will 
be a Championship (gross) flight and well as three Net 
flights: First, Second, and Women.

title: West Virginia Senior Amateur Championship
notes:
Entries are open to male amateur golfers with an 
active GHIN Handicap index through a WVGA 
Member 
Club, and who are 50 years of age or older by the 
first 
round of Championship. The tournament will be 36 
holes of stroke play qualifying followed by match 
play. 
Thirty-two players will advance in the Senior 
Division, 
16 players will advance in the Silver Division, and 8 
players will advance in the Gold Division.

title: Tri-State Matches
notes:
The history of the Tri-State Matches dates back to 1907 when the team from Massachusetts was victorious at the Agawam Hunt Club in Providence, Rhode Island.

Since that time, teams from Massachusetts, Rhode Island and Connecticut have come together each fall to compete for the regional title. Individual amateur golfers are selected each year by the respective state golf associations.

title: Georgia Senior Women's Amateur Championship
notes:
Open to female amateur golfers age 50 and above as of the first day of the competition for the Championship or Senior Division or age 65 and above for the Super Senior Division

Field: 132 player-maximum divided between elective Championship, Senior or Super Senior Divisions; A number of players to be determined with the lowest USGA Handicap Indexes per division will be accepted

Format: 36 holes of flighted stroke play

title: Georgia Women's Team Championship
notes:
Entries: Open to two-person teams of female amateur golfers who have a maximum handicap differential of eight strokes. Must be 18 years old as of the first day of the tournament.

Field: 60-80 teams - players may elect to compete in the Championship Grodd Division or the Net Division; up to 10 teams will comprise the Championship Division.

Format: Round One - 18 holes of four-ball gross stroke play for Championship flight and four-ball net stroke play for remaining flights; Round Two - scramble format

title: Hawaii Women's Stroke Play Championship
notes:
36 hole flighted stroke play championship for Hawaii 
women amateurs.

title: U.S. Open Golf Championship
notes:
The U.S. Open is the biggest of the 14 national championships conducted by the USGA. Open to amateurs and professionals.

The USGA intends to make the U.S. Open the most rigorous, yet fair, examination of golf skills, testing all forms of shot-making. The USGA prepares the course after careful consideration of 14 different factors.
courseName: Winged Foot Golf Club - West Course

title: Men's World Amateur Team Golf Championship (Eisenhower Trophy) - CANCELLED
notes:
**Cancelled due to the coronavirus outbreak.

In 1958 the United States Golf Association asked The R&A to join them in sponsoring a world-wide amateur golf team event to be played biennially in non-Walker Cup years. Between 35 and 40 nations were represented at the first meeting and President Dwight D. Eisenhower presented the trophy which bears his name. The committee of the event was to be known as the World Amateur Golf Council and is now the International Golf Federation. Teams of four players from each country competed over 72 holes with the leading three scores from each round to count. The first competition was held between 29 nations at St Andrews, with Australia beating the United States in a play-off. In 2002 the format changed to teams of three with the two leading scores to count.

title: Northern Nevada Amateur Championship
notes:
54 Hole Stroke Play Championship of Northern 
Nevada. 36 hole stroke play for Net division. 
Starting field of 56 in each division.

title: Greater Cincinnati Metropolitan Senior Women's Amateur Championship
notes:
Open to women senior amateurs who are members 
of 
the GCGA and age 50+. 36-hole stroke play event 
with 
gross and net scoring. The field will be divided into 
the 
following divisions: 50-54, 55-59, 60-64, 65-69, 
70+.

title: Idaho Tournament of Champions
notes:
36-hole stroke play tournament for men, seniors, 
women, and senior women. 
Invitations determined by performance during the 
current year's golf season. Entries 
are open to amateur golfers who must have an 
up-to-date USGA Handicap Index®. A 
Handicap Index must either be issued from an 
IGA District I, II, or III member “golf 
club” (as defined in the “USGA Handicap System 
Manual”) which is licensed to use the 
USGA Handicap SystemTM . Or, for bona fide 
residents of the State of Idaho, Panhandle 
District have an up-to-date USGA Handicap 
Index® issued from a WSGA licensed 
member “golf club.”

title: New Mexico Open Championship - CANCELLED
notes:
**Cancelled due to the coronavirus outbreak.

54 hole stroke play tournament open to professionals and amateurs. The field will be cut to the top 50 players and ties after 36 holes.

title: Bob Goldwater Cup Matches
notes:
Walker Cup style team matches between teams 
of Arizona amateurs and Southwest Section PGA 
professionals.

title: Palm Beach County Junior-Senior Tournament
notes:
The first round will be Modified Alternate Shot 
and the second round will be Better Ball. 
Open to all PBCGA members. Two Man Teams 
will consist of 1 senior player (50 or older) 
and one junior player (49 or younger). Flights 
will be determined by first round scores.

title: ANA Inspiration Championship
notes:
First women's professional major of the year, 
the 
ANA Inspiration (formerly the Kraft Nabisco) 
Championship draws more than 
100 
of the best women professional golfers in the 
world, as well as the top-ranked amateurs in the 
country.

title: The Honors Matches - CANCELLED
notes:
**Cancelled for 2020

The Honors Matches are a biennial team event between the top players from the SCGA and SCPGA. The inaugural match was played in 2007. At these matches, the SCGA and SCPGA honor and celebrate an individual from each organization for their past accomplishments and dedicated service to the game of golf. Past SCGA honorees include Bud Bradley, Mark Johnson, Steve Horrell, Tom Morgan, and Jim Vernon. Past SCPGA honorees include Eddie Merrins, Len Kennett, Ron O’Connor, Jerry Anderson, and Tom Barber.

The teams are selected based upon their respective points systems. The top eight players and top four seniors are invited to represent their respective Associations.

title: California High School Girls State Championship
notes:
The California Interscholastic Federation is divided 
into four districts, and each provides contestants in 
the events based on district student population. The 
State Championship is a one-day event run by the 
NCGA and SCGA, with teams and individual students 
competing in 18 holes of stroke play. The top six 
individuals and top three teams of each region 
(Northern and Southern) advance to the State 
Championship, which rotates each year between 
Northern and Southern sites.

title: TaylorMade Pebble Beach Invitational
notes:
Founded in 1972, the Taylormade Pebble 
Beach Invitational has long claimed a unique 
mantle as the world's only tournament that 
matches players from the PGA, the LPGA, 
the Champions, and Nationwide Tours in 
head-to-head competition for the same 
purse – and also matches teams of four 
amateurs with a different pro each day. 2015 
sponsor changed from Callaway to TaylorMade.

title: Michigan Senior Four-Ball Championship
notes:
36-hole four-ball stroke play event for Senior Men 
(55+) and Super Senior Men (65+). Must be a GAM 
member.

title: Metropolitan Golf Association Mid-Amateur Championship
notes:
This championship brings together a field of the best 
30-and-over golfers the Met Area has to offer. The 
36-
hole stroke-play event is an invitational and players 
gain entry based on high finishes in selected MGA 
and 
Met Area events. The winner is awarded the 
Westmoreland Cup, named for long-time MGA 
Tournament Director Gene Westmoreland.

title: Hieronymus Cup Matches
notes:
This match play team event is set up in a 
foursome, four-ball and singles format. 
Members of each 20-player team (East vs. West) are 
selected by points earned in the Missouri Golf 
Association Point Events, plus captain's picks. There are 
two Divisions regular and senior (50+) within each Cup 
Team.

title: Cobb-Whalen Cup Matches
notes:
Ryder Cup style team matches between the 
Southern 
Nevada Golf Association (SNGA) and Northern 
Nevada 
Golf Association (NNGA). Held every other year, with 
the host site rotating between Northern and 
Southern 
Nevada.

title: West Virginia Club Team Championship
notes:
Entries are open to male and female amateur golfers with an active GHIN Handicap Index through a WVGA Member Club. and professionals who are “Regular Members” of the WVGA.

Men’s Championship Division: Consists of four (4) male amateur golfers plus one (1) professional or amateur captain. The low four (4) gross scores after 18-holes of stroke play will count towards your team score and the overall Men’s Club Team Championship. The Men’s Championship Division will play the full length Men’s set of tees. Men’s Senior Division: Consists of three (3) male senior amateur golfers plus one (1) professional or amateur captain. The low three (3) gross scores after 18-holes of stroke play will count towards your team score and the overall Men’s Senior Club Team Championship. The Men’s Senior Flight will compete from the senior length set of tees. Women’s Division: Consists of three (3) female amateur golfers plus one (1) professional or amateur captain. The low three (3) gross scores after 18 holes of stroke play will count towards your team score and the overall Women’s Club Team Championship.

title: Philadelphia Women's Tournament of Champions
notes:
Open to all current Club Champions of Member 
Clubs of The Women's Golf Association of 
Philadelphia and previous winners of the 
Tournament of Champions (who are individual 
Association Members with all privileges). 
 
If a Club Champion is unable to play, the 
current Runner-up is then eligible.
 
The Defending Champion is eligible to play 
even if she is not the current Champion at her 
Club.

title: Southern California Super Senior Championship
notes:
This championship is open to SCGA members who 
are age 65 and above and have a USGA handicap 
index of 10.4 or below. The championship is a 36-
hole individual stroke play event, there is no 
qualifying as all entries are on a first come, first 
serve basis. For eight years this championship was 
incorporated into the SCGA Senior Amateur as a 
separate division. Starting in 2008 the Super Senior 
Division was removed from the Senior Amateur 
Championship into its own 36-hole championship.

title: Southern California Senior Tournament of Club Champions
notes:
Senior men’s club champions, age 55 and over, are 
invited to play in this 18-hole event. The senior club 
champion must have a Handicap Index of 5.4 or 
below as of the date of registration. They must be an 
amateur member in good standing with the SCGA 
and a member on the club’s active SCGA roster at 
the time they won the championship. This Division 
will compete without handicaps. Senior men’s club 
champions with a Handicap Index of 5.5 and above 
will play in the net divisions. Senior men’s club 
champions that have not reached their 55th birthday 
by the date of the championship are not eligible for 
this Division.

title: North Carolina Super Senior Amateur Championship - CANCELLED
notes:
**Cancelled in 2020.

Open to any male golfer 65 and older, a resident of North Carolina, a member of a CGA member club, and an index that does not exceed 15.4.

title: Rhode Island Senior Amateur Championship
notes:
36-hole stroke play championship for seniors, super 
seniors and legends. Eligibility: Age 55 & over.  
Gross & 
Net Divisions. Member of RIGA member club.

title: Arkansas Randy Beaver Cup Matches
notes:
Team matches between the Arkansas State Golf 
Association (ASGA) and Arkansas PGA.

title: Greater San Antonio Mid-Amateur Championship
notes:
Open to any man or woman with amateur status, 25 
years or older, and residing in Bexar, Comal, 
Kendall, 
Wilson, Atascosa, Medina, Guadalupe, or Bandera 
counties for a minimum of three months prior to the 
Championship date. (Military residents exempt from 
three month residency requirement.)

title: Connecticut Two-Man Team Championship
notes:
36-holes of stroke play.  Round one format will be 
four-
ball and round two format will be foursomes 
(selected 
drive). Combined team handicap may not exceed 
13.0.

title: Julius Boros Challenge Cup
notes:
This co-sponsored event pits fourteen amateurs 
from the CSGA versus fourteen PGA 
Professionals 
from the Connecticut Section. Player’s play both 
an individual and team match simultaneously 
with 
three points available per match.

title: Connecticut Senior Match Play Championship
notes:
The tournament, which is the first of two majors for 
senior golfers on the CSGA schedule, challenges 
competitors with a round of stroke play to determine 
the low sixteen match play qualifiers followed by two 
rounds of match play each day that culminate in an 
eighteen-hole final match.

title: Francis B. Warner Cup
notes:
Format: Eighteen hole individual stroke play.

Eligibility: Open to Senior male golfers, 55 years of age and older and Super-Senior male golfers, 65 years of age and older. Players must be members of a Member Club with a USGA Handicap Index of 7.0 or lower. A Super Senior may play in the "Seniors Tournament," play to be from the Senior Tees.

title: New Jersey Women's Senior Amateur Championship
notes:
Open to senior female amateurs aged 50 and over 
who 
are members 
with a NJSGA club. Format is 36 holes of stroke 
play.

title: Rolex Girls Junior Championship
notes:
One of the AJGA series of tournaments that require an 
invitation to participate. For girls ages 12-19. Format is 
54 holes of stroke play. Must be AJGA member.

title: Rolex Tournament of Champions
notes:
One of the AJGA series of tournaments that 
require an invitation to participate. Format is 
72 
holes of stroke play, with boys and girls competitions.

title: Junior Players Championship
notes:
One of the AJGA series of tournaments that 
require an invitation to participate. Format is 
54 holes of stroke play.

title: The PING Invitational Junior
notes:
One of the AJGA series of tournaments that 
require an invitation to participate. Format is 54 
holes of stroke play.

title: Bobby Chapman Junior Invitational
notes:
36 hole stroke play event. The tournament is 
held in honor of the late Robert H. Chapman, 
Jr. Chapman, a long time member of the 
Country Club of Spartanburg, was the only 
man to serve as president of both the South 
Carolina Golf Association & Carolinas Golf 
Association. He was an accomplished player 
and served the USGA in several capacities. In 
his business life, Chapman was a local and 
national leader in the textile industry. The 
tournament also benefits the Spartanburg 
Foundation and the South Carolina Junior Golf 
Foundation.

title: Chicago District Senior Four-Ball Championship
notes:
The Championship is open to any CDGA Member, 
who 
has reached his 55th birthday on or before the 
start 
of 
the championship and has an individual handicap 
index 
not exceeding 10.4. The format is 18-
holes of stroke play qualifying which
determines the low 16 who will advance to match 
play.

title: Sun Country Fall Stroke Play Championship
notes:
Must be a SCAGA member. 36-hole stroke play 
event 
with men's and women's championship, men's 
senior 
championship, and net flights.

title: New Mexico - West Texas Senior Amateur Championship
notes:
Must be a SCAGA member. 36-hole stroke play 
competition with women's senior (50+), men's 
senior 
(50+), 
men's 
super senior (60+), and men's master senior (70+) 
divisions. 
There 
will be net and championship flights.

title: Sun Country Challenge Cup
notes:
The annual event features 16 SCAGA members facing off in a team event versus the 16-person team of the Sun Country PGA. Teams from both associations are made up of 12 regular/junior members and four senior (50+).

SCAGA will make good faith effort to include the following on the team: At least two mid-amateurs, at least two juniors, at least one woman, & one captain’s pick made by TCC and SCAGA Staff.

Format: 36 holes over the course of one day including team matches in the morning and singles matches in the afternoon
courseName: New Mexico State University Golf Course

title: New Mexico - West Texas Mid-Amateur Championship
notes:
Must be a SCAGA member. Open to men and 
women age 25 and up. 36-hole stroke play open 
with 
gross and net flights.

title: Sun Country Team Championship
notes:
Must be a SCAGA member. 36-hole team 
competition 
with four-ball stroke play the first round followed by 
a 
modified alternate shot in the second round. There 
will 
be gross and net flights for men and women along 
with 
men's senior gross and net flights, plus a supr senior 
flight.

title: Senior Golf Association of Northern California Four-Ball Championship
notes:
36-hole four-ball Stableford championship for SGANC 
members. Gross and Net flights.

title: Michigan Tournament of Champions
notes:
18-hole stroke play tournament open to Men and 
Women who have won their GAM Club

title: Fox Puss Invitational
notes:
54 hole stroke play format tournament was given the name “FOX PUSS” to honor two of Boonsboro’s members that for many years had devoted their talents and time to amateur golf in the State of Virginia and the Lynchburg area, Mr. H. M. “Fox” Blankinship and Mr. Charles “Puss” Hancock. Both of these gentlemen were former Presidents of the Virginia State Golf Association. This is the ruling body for Amateur golf within the State of Virginia. Additionally, Mr. Hancock was a long term President of Boonsboro Country Club.

The first tournament was held late in 1971 and has continued each year. While we have had to cancel the tournament three times over the years, we have been able to retain a high level of competition for the contestants. Our Champions and contestants have been State Amateur Champions; United States Amateur Champion; British Amateur Champion; and Walker Cup Members.

title: European Amateur Championship
notes:
The premier championship in 
Europe, 
conducted by the European Golf 
Association, 
which is comprised of 38 member 
countries. 72 
hole stroke play format. After 54 holes the field is cut 
to the leading 60 players and ties. The winner earns 
a spot in the British Open.

Europe, conducted by the European Golf 
Association, which is comprised of 38 member 
countries. 54 hole stroke play format.

title: European Ladies Amateur Championship
notes:

Europe, conducted by the European Golf 
Association, which is comprised of 38 member

throughout the state. Players must have an index of 
7.4 or less and may attempt to qualify at any 
location in the state.

Tennessee State University. Team (best four scores out 
of five players each round) and individual competitions.

Louisiana

title: Minnesota MGA-PGA Cup Matches - CANCELLED
notes:
**Cancelled due to the coronavirus outbreak.

Team matches between teams representing the Minnesota Golf Association (MGA) and the Minnesota PGA Section.

Each team is comprised of 20 individuals - 4 Senior Men, 4 Women, and 12 Regular Division Men. Play is in groups of four, with two amateurs and two professionals. The Amateurs will play a Four-Ball team match against the Professionals, while each Amateur plays a Single match against one of the Professionals. Each Four-Ball match is worth two (2) points while each Single match is worth one (1) point. The first team to 20.5 points wins the Cup, but if the matches end in a tie, the team currently holding the Cup will retain it for the next year.

title: The Hudson Cup Matches
notes:
The Hudson Cup Matches and Senior Hudson Cup Matches are conducted by the Pacific Northwest Section of the PGA of America in cooperation with the Oregon and Washington State Golf Associations. The matches pit the top amateurs against the top professionals.

Each player plays three matches: A Foursome Match, a Four-Ball Match and a Singles Match. At the completion of the events, awards are presented to the outstanding player on each team as decided by votes of the team members. The awards honor Chuck Congdon, Larry Lamberger, Bob McKendrick, and Bill Eggers, four great players with outstanding Hudson Cup records.

title: Art Wall, Jr. Memorial
notes:

Eligibility: The Art Wall, Jr. Major is open to any male amateur golfer, age 45 and older, who is member of a club belonging to the Pennsylvania Golf Association or an individual member of the Pennsylvania Golf Association.

title: Iowa Cup Matches
notes:
Team matches between the amateur team of the Iowa Golf Association (IGA) and the professional team of the Iowa PGA Section.

Iowa Cup Match Format:
Round 1 – Four-Ball Matches – 18 Holes, 1 point per match
Round 2 – Foursome Matches (Alternate Shot) – 18 Holes, 1 point per match
Round 3 – Singles Matches – 18 Holes, 1 point per match
TOTAL POINTS – Round 1 = 10 + Round 2 = 10 + Round 3 = 20 = 40 Total Points

title: Asia-Pacific Amateur Championship
notes:
The Asia-Pacific Amateur (formerly known as the Asian Amateur) is the first of a series of worldwide championships put together by a between the Asia Pacific Golf Confederation (APGC), the Masters Tournament and The R&A. The event offers the winner an invitation to the Masters Tournament at Augusta National Golf Club and the British Open Championship. The event has historically moved throughout the region and has now been held in China, Japan, Singapore, Thailand, Australia and Hong Kong, Korea, and New Zealand.

A field, topping out at 120 players, is selected by the following criteria.

The top two ranked amateur players from each of the APGC member countries plus the four top ranked players from the host country. If there is not a sufficient number of players ranked from that member country, the member country may nominate a player(s) from their country, to be approved by the APGC, to fulfill the two positions eligible from that country.

The remainder of the field will be filled taking the next highest ranked players of APGC member countries, not otherwise qualified. The maximum number of eligible players from any APGC member country (with the exception of the host country) is six. Additional players may be offered at the event's discretion.

title: Western Pennsylvania Four-Ball Championship
notes:
Four-Ball is the most common form of play 
in western Pennsylvania. The Association's 
Four-Ball Championship was first played in 
1939, and the winners of the inaugural 
were L.R. Siebert and Jack Benson. The 
Siebert and Benson team also won the 
second in 1940. Originally open only to 
teams with members from the same 
Member Club, the event is now open to 
any players who reside in the western 
Pennsylvania district who meet handicap 
eligibility. The championship is thirty-six 
holes.

Many of the names on the Joseph Shea 
Alexander Memorial Trophy are scattered 
across the record books of our 
championships. Former Amateur 
Champions to be a part of a winning Four-
Ball team include Knox Young, Jack 
Benson, Frank Souchak, Bob Reilly, John 
Birmingham, Frank Fuhrer, III, Marshall 
Marraccini, Sean Knapp, and David Brown.

title: Nebraska Women's Pinehurst
notes:
Started in 2018, this is a 36-hole competition comprised of two- person teams. In Pinehurst, each partner plays from the teeing ground and then plays their partner’s ball for their second shot. After the second shot, partners select the ball with which they wish to score and play that ball alternately to complete the hole. Team Handicap in Pinehurst combines 60 percent of the lower player’s Course Handicap and 40 percent of the higher player’s Course Handicap.

Players must be a current member of NWAGA, except for Qualified Juniors. Upon receipt of a Valid Entry, any Qualified Junior (defined as a member of NJGT and with a Handicap index of 20.0 or less), may compete in NWAGA events. Each Player must have an active USGA Handicap index.

In 1945 the Pinehurst (NC) Outlook recognized Mr. Bartholomew by publishing the following: “Harry Bartholomew is one of too few individuals who long ago decided that golf is such a grand game that working men ought to be come acquainted with. He founded a working man’s golf Club in Bristol, Connecticut – The Pequabuck Golf Club”.

During the course of play, a Pro-Am is also conducted with the three amateurs and their Club Professional (Club professional can be of any age) using the best two gross balls per hole. The Lathrop Cup is a great opportunity for members and their Professional to spend a day together and compete against other SCGA Member clubs throughout the State.

prizes. 
All participants must be a permanent resident of 
McLennan County and at least 16 years of age.

title: Utah Four-Ball Championship
notes:
Format: Four-Ball stroke play. All play will be gross within divisions.

Eligibility: Each player must be a current member of the UGA. For a team to qualify for the Senior Men’s division, both players must be 50 years or older as of the first day of competition.

title: Northern California Women's Four-Ball Net Championship
notes:
First played in 2006, the NCGA Northern California 
Women’s Four-Ball Net Championship is a two-person, 
better-ball handicap event for NCGA, WGANC or PWGA 
members.  The event is contested in three flights – Big 
Sur (combined team index 30.2-lower), Golden Gate 
(30.3-44.0) and Yosemite (44.1 and higher), divided by 
handicap index. Format is 36 holes four-ball stroke 
play.

title: Chatmoss Team Invitational
notes:
Four-ball event run by Chatmoss Country Club, 
who also runs a well-known invitational stroke 
play event in April. Open division plus a senior 
division, flighted after day one.

title: Old Waverly Invitational
notes:
The Old Waverly Invitational is scheduled as 36 
holes 
of 
stroke play. Divisions: Men's, Senior (50+), Super 
Senior (60+). Flights will be determined following 18 
holes of play. Players will be re-paired following the 
first 
round based on score. The number of flights is 
based 
on field size with awards following completion of the 
second round.

title: Morris Mens Invitational
notes:
36 hole stroke play tournament with open and senior 
divisions, hosted by Morris Country Club.

title: Tom Hoover Ozark Invitational
notes:
36-hole stroke play tournament with Championship and 
Senior (age 50+) divisions.

title: Jimmy Anderson Girls' Invitational
notes:
36-hole stroke play event. All players compete in one division. Open to girls ages 13-18 (CGA membership not required).

This annual junior tournament was started by the alumni of the Jacksonville Country Club junior golf program in 2009 to honor their longtime teacher and friend Mr. Jimmy Anderson. Jimmy Anderson was the head golf professional at Jacksonville Country Club for over 25 years. Each Saturday morning, he conducted a junior golf clinic to help spread the game of golf to the next generation. During his tenure at Jacksonville CC, he taught many juniors including Mallory Miller, the 1987 N.C. Junior Champion and numerous future collegiate and golf professionals. Not only did he teach the game of golf, but was always there with a helpful word of encouragement to any young golfer.

title: South Carolina Open Championship
notes:
36 hole stroke play championship for professionals 
and 
amateurs. Amateurs must reside in North or South 
Carolina and have a current USGA Handicap Index of 
5.5 or less at the time of entry deadline, verified by 
a 
CPGA Professional.

title: Tennessee Senior & Super Senior Four-Ball Championship
notes:
Open to senior and super-senior teams who are 
members of the TGA. Format consists of 36 holes of 
stroke play followed by a cut to the low 8 seniors 
and 
low 4 super seniors for match play.

title: Rocky Mountain Open Championship
notes:
54-hole stroke play event. One of the oldest 
events in Colorado. Celebrated its 80th year in 
2018.

title: The Rudy's I-35 Cup - CANCELLED
notes:
**Cancelled due to the coronavirus outbreak.

Team matches between best amateur players from cities of Austin and San Antonio, Texas. The matches take place over two days, Saturday through Sunday, a total of 28 matches. On Saturday, there are seven, four ball matches in the morning (or afternoon) and seven foursomes matches in the morning (or afternoon). On Sunday, there are 14 singles matches, when all team members play. The winning team is determined by cumulative total points.
courseName: Fair Oaks Ranch Golf & Country Club - Blackjack Course

title: Richmond Senior Championship
notes:
Must be a male member in good standing of an RGA 
member
club and must be at least 50 years of age on the 
first 
day of the tournament. Super Senior
entrant must be a male member in good standing of 
an RGA member club and must be at
least 65 years of age on the first day of the 
tournament. Format is 36-holes of stroke play.

title: Worcester Labor Day Four-Ball Tournament
notes:
36-hole four-ball stroke play tournament limited to 
the 
first 30 teams to enter. Team players must be within 
5.0 handicap index of each other.

title: Greater Lansing Spring Medal Play Championship
notes:
36-hole flighted stroke play championship with Open, 
Senior and Super Senior divisions. Discounted entry 
fees available for those that choose to donate 
annually 
to the GLAGA for promotion of junior golf.

title: Two Rivers Country Club Senior Invitational
notes:
First played in 2009, this is a 54-hole stroke play 
competition for seniors (50-64), 
super-seniors (65+) and legends (70+). The
field is limited to 80 contestants with an established 
handicap index of 10.0 or
less as selected by the Two Rivers Senior Invitational 
Committee.

title: Syracuse District Best-Ball Championship
notes:
Both members of the team must be a member of 
SDGA or an SDGA Associate Member club. Format is 
36 
holes of four-ball stroke play.

title: Syracuse District Senior Best-Ball Championship
notes:
36-hole four-ball stroke play event for players aged 55 
and over. Entrants must be an SDGA member and have 
an active USGA Handicap Index issued through a 
licensed golf club.
