title: Chanticleer National Four-Ball Invitational
notes:
The goal of the Chanticleer National Four-Ball is 
to serve as one of the game's most prestigious and 
competitive Four-Ball events. The event is held 
annually at the Robert Trent Jones-designed 
Chanticleer Course at Greenville Country Club and 
it's 
the perfect place to provide competitors a 
challenging 
layout that lends itself to risk-reward shotmaking. 
This 36 hole tournament will be played at scratch. 
The field of fifty teams will be 
chosen based on strength of resume and date of 
entry.

title: U.S. Amateur Four-Ball Qualifying
notes:
Conducted over 18 holes, sectional qualifying 
is held at sites across the United States 
from late summer to spring.
courseName: Various sites across the United States

title: Michigan Four-Ball Championship
notes:
18-hole four-ball stroke play event with two shotgun 
starts, one in the morning and one in the afternoon. 
Men, two-person teams with a maximum handicap 
index of 10.8.

title: South Carolina Forty-Plus Series Finale
notes:
Open to male members of the SCGA who are over 
the 
age of 40. Field will be limited to 50 teams – 36 in 
the 
Championship Division (ages 40-54) & 14 in the 
Senior 
Division. 36-hole four ball stroke play will decide the 
low championship and net winners.

title: Virginia Super Senior Stroke Play Championship
notes:
36-hole stroke play competition (18 holes per day). 
Open to VSGA members 65 years of age or older 
holding an active GHIN number issued by a licensed 
VSGA Member Club in good standing.

title: Jacksonville Senior Amateur Championship
notes:
Three-day 54-hole stroke play event with a Senior 
Division (50+) and concurrent two-day, 36 hole 
competitions for the Super Senior and Grand Senior 
Divisions.
courseName: St. Johns Golf and Country Club

title: Victorian Amateur Championship
notes:
The low 32 finishers in the Port Phillip Amateur qualify 
for elimination match play in the Victorian Amateur.

title: North of England Open Amateur Championship
notes:
72-hole stroke play event played over three 
days, with a cut after 36 holes to the low 32 players 
and ties. Handicap limit 1.4.

title: Southern California Junior Amateur Championship
notes:
The Southern California Junior Amateur Golf 
Championship is co-
hosted by the SCGA and the SCPGA. Started in 
2015, this 
championship was created to determine the best 
junior golfers in 
Southern California. The boys championship is open 
to Southern 
California male amateur golfers with an established 
USGA 
Handicap Index of 5.4 or below who are 18 years of 
age or 
younger. The girls championship is open to Southern 
California 
female amateur golfers with an established USGA 
Handicap Index 
of 9.4 or below who are 18 years of age or younger. 
The 
Championships are conducted over 36 holes of 
stroke play.
courseName: Morongo Golf Club at Tukwet Canyon - Champions Course

title: European Amateur Team Championship
notes:
Teams of 6 players representing their home (European) country. Two rounds of stroke play qualifying in a best- 5-scores-of-6 format determines two match play brackets of 8 teams each.

Team matches consist of two best-ball matches and five singles matches, with the team winning more points (out of 7 total) advancing.

title: English Women's Open Amateur Stroke Play Championship
notes:
A maximum of 144 players will contest this 72-hole stroke play championship.

The full field will play 18 holes on each of the first two days. Then the leading 40 competitors and ties will play the final 36 holes on the third day.

The winner will return the lowest gross score over 72 holes.

title: Belgian International Amateur Stroke Play Championship - CANCELLED
notes:
**Cancelled due to the coronavirus outbreak.

72-hole stroke play championship for men and women that draws an international field. Cut after 36 holes.

title: U.S. Women's Amateur Four-Ball Qualifying
notes:
Conducted over 18 holes, sectional qualifying 
is held at sites across the United States 
from late summer to spring.
courseName: Various sites across the United States

title: The Pricey Par-3 Golf Tournament
notes:
**Postponed due to the coronavirus outbreak.

One-day, Par-3 tournament played in a Four-Ball Stroke Play format. Open to amateurs and professionals, and several PGA Tour professionals compete each year. Sponsored by World Golf Hall of Fame Member, Nick Price. There is a restriction on the number of clubs a team can use: 1 or 2 Putters + 5 Additional Clubs

title: Argentine Stroke Play Championship
notes:
72-hole stroke play event in Argentina. Second 
largest national event besides the Argentine 
Amateur, which is a match play event in the 
winter/spring.

title: Illinois Senior Women’s Amateur Championship
notes:
The event is open to women who are residents of 
Illinois, have a handicap index of 30.0 or less, and 
have 
reached their 50th birthday by the tournament date. 
The tournament format is 54 holes of stroke play. 
Players are paired by scores with flights also 
established by age groups. This tournament is the 
most popular of the three IWGA events and typically 
has a full field.

title: Kwazulu Natal Amateur Match Play Championship - CANCELLED
notes:
**Cancelled due to the coronavirus outbreak.

Match play championship with regional qualifiers.

title: Northern Virginia Senior Amateur
notes:
36-hole stroke play tournament with Senior, Super 
Senior and Net divisions.

title: Moore County Amateur Championship
notes:
36-hole stroke play championship with Open, Senior 
(ages 55+), 
and Super Senior (65+, 70+, 75+) flights. Open to 
men, 16 years of age 
and older. No residency requirement.

title: Massachusetts Super Senior Amateur Championship
notes:
Making its debut in 2014, the Massachusetts Super Senior Amateur Championship was launched in order to crown the top senior amateur competitor who is 65 years or older.

Entries are open to amateur golfers who hold membership in an MGA member club, who have reached their 65th birthday by start of tournament and have an up-to-date MGA/USGA GHIN Handicap Index not exceeding 12.0 or have completed their handicap certification as defined on the Entry Form.

title: Lehigh Valley Amateur Tournament
notes:
The Lehigh Valley Amateur Tournament is held in 
September and attracts hundreds of golfers from all 
over the area. 18 holes of stroke play to determine 
seeding for a 64-player match play bracket. There is 
also a second flight, as well as Junior, Senior (x 2), and 
Super Senior flights.

title: East Lake Cup Collegiate Match Play Championship
notes:
Started in 2015 and hosted by the historic 
East 
Lake Golf Club Atlanta, this collegiate, three-day 
match
play competition features the top-performing 
teams 
from the previous year's NCAA Men’s
Golf Championships. There is an individual award for 
the low 18-hole scorer 
in the seeding round.

title: Short Par 4 Fall Classic
notes:
This 72-hole event uses four types of team 
competition 
while playing spectacular golf courses in the 
Myrtle 
Beach area. Day one is Best-Ball, day two is Texas 
Scramble, day three is Best-Ball, and 
day 
four is Modified Alternate Shot.

title: Forsyth Seniors Tournament
notes:
The deadline to enter tournament is one week before 
tournament date and it is for Forsyth County residents 
only.  Applications will be available one month before 
the deadline. Applications will be distributed to all area 
golf courses, on the City of Winston-Salem website and 
mailed to 
participants from last year’s tournament.
courseName: Maple Chase Golf and Country Club

title: The Egg Invitational
notes:
The Egg Invitational is a two-day 54 hole scratch Four-Ball event. 36 Holes are slated for the first day of competition with a shotgun start and 18 holes of play on the final day. The Egg aims to bring together players from the nation’s finest facilities for two days of great golf and camaraderie.

The host course is a Tom Fazio design ranked as high as #52 on Golf Digest’s America’s 100 Greatest Courses. Situated in the foothills of the Appalachian Mountains, the course has hosted the MAC Championship and NCAA Division I Men’s Central Regional, and features gently rolling countryside, dramatic elevation changes, unique wetlands, and a plentiful mix of mature woods.

On-site lodging is available upon request.

title: Georgia Senior Open
notes:
Open to all Professionals and Amateurs who live in 
the 
state of Georgia and are age 50 or older. Senior and 
Super Senior (age 65+) divisions.

title: Society of Seniors Founders Cup
notes:
Created in 2016, this tournament is a 54-hole stroke 
play championship with Senior, Super Senior and 
Grand Master Divisions.

title: Michigan Senior/Mid-Amateur Team Championship
notes:
This unique Championship features one 
day of 
competition that will include 18 holes of 
four-ball 
and 18 holes of foursomes. Three qualifying sites in 
May determine the final teams (one from each of the 
three locations) who play in 
September for the championship. Teams for this 
event 
will be made up of at least one player who 
has 
reached their 55th birthday prior to the 
Championship along with a second player 
who has 
reached their 25th birthday. Must be a 
GAM 
member.

title: Minnesota Public Golf Association Four-Ball Championship
notes:
36-hole four-ball stroke play championship with 
Championship, Senior (ages 50+) and Net divisions. 
This Championship is open to amateur players who 
are 
a member of a club that is a member of the 
Minnesota 
Public Golf Association (MPGA) and has a current 
active 
GHIN handicap at that club.

title: Hartford Women's Open Championship
notes:
Played for the first time in 2016, the event is open 
to 
amateur and professional golfers. The event is a 36-
hole 
event played at Hartford, CT's two public golf 
course, 
Goodwin Park and Keney Park.

title: Augusta City Amateur
notes:
For 2020 this will be a two-round event.

The Augusta City Amateur Golf Tournament at Forest Hills is a long-standing tradition for Augusta golfers. Handicaps are not needed, the Augusta City Amateur is a flighted event. Players will play two rounds and be designated to a flight based on scores. Prizes will be awarded to the top 33% in each flight based on the low three-day scores. There will be a cut after two rounds, keeping the top 60 players and ties in the Open division (ages 16 and older), and 36 and ties in the Senior division (ages 50 and older).

title: Big Island Amateur Championship - CANCELLED
notes:
**Cancelled due to the coronavirus outbreak.

Until 2020, this tournament had never skipped a year since being founded in 1924. 36-hole stroke play championship with championship, senior and net flights.

title: Staten Island Senior Amateur Champonship
notes:
Match play seeding determined by qualifying held prior 
to the championship. Matches are played over 
consecutive weekends at two different courses.

title: Leo Spooner Memorial Invitational
notes:
36-hole two-man best-ball tournament with Regular 
and Senior (both players ages 55+) divisions. Like its 
companion individual event held at the same 
club, this event has been run for decades and 
attracts a talented group of scratch Midwest golfers 
each year. The Northland Country Club, a Donald Ross 
design, plays host.

title: Veteran Golfers Association Championship
notes:
The Veteran Golfers Association is committed to 
promoting the game of golf to veterans and their 
family members. The VGA Championship is the 
organization's national 36-hole stroke play 
competition for VGA 
members who have made it through one of four 
regional qualifiers. Players divided are into four 
men's 
flights (A,B, C and D) and one women's flight (F) 
based 
on skill-level.
courseName: Trump National Doral - Blue Monster Course

title: East Lake Cup Collegiate Women's Match Play Championship
notes:
Started in 2015 and hosted by the historic 
East 
Lake Golf Club Atlanta, this collegiate, two-day 
match
play competition features the top-performing 
teams 
from the previous year's NCAA Women's
Golf Championships.

title: Bradenton City Amateur
notes:
Open to all male amateurs golfers with 
championship, senior 
and super senior divisions. Format consists of 36 
holes 
stroke play with flights to be determined after the 
first 
round.

title: The Gobbler Amateur
notes:
Founded in 2016, the Gobbler Invitational is a 54-hole 
stroke play event with no cut. It is open to male 
amateur golfers with an index of 3.0 or less. A variety 
of exemption categories are offered, based mostly on 
rankings and USGA appearances. The top 10 finishers 
will be exempt into 
the Saguaro Amateur in January.

title: Minnesota Women's Senior Amateur Four-Ball Championship
notes:
Format is 36-holes, Four-Ball stroke play without 
handicap to be conducted over two days, with no cut. 
The field will be flighted after the close of entries, and 
teams will be assigned to a flight based on the lowest 
individual handicap index of the two team members.

title: Tennessee Senior & Super Senior Match Play
notes:
Open to male senior amateurs who are members of 
the 
TGA with a handicap less than 10. Format consists 
of 
36 holes of stroke play followed by a cut to the low 
16 
for match play.

title: New York State Open Championship
notes:
Open to professionals and amateurs who reside in 
the 
state of New York. An 18-hole qualifier is required 
for 
those who do not meet the exemption criteria. 
Format 
consists of 54-holes of stroke play with a cut to the 
low 
60 and ties after the 2nd round.

title: American Seniors Cape Cod Clambake
notes:
54-hole stroke-play event held on Cape Cod just 
after 
the height of tourism season

title: Connecticut Father & Son Championship
notes:
18-hole foursomes (selected drive alternate shot) 
stroke play championship. Combined Team Handicap 
may not exceed 18.0.

title: Vermont Fall Four-Ball Tournament
notes:
Residents of Vermont must be a member of a club of 
the VGA. Non-residents can be members of a VGA 
member club for 3 years. Format: 36 holes stroke 
play; 18 holes on Saturday and 18 holes Sunday. 
The 
Tournament will be flighted based on combined 
handicaps as follows: 
1. Championship Flight: Combined handicaps of 12 
or 
less. 
2. Net Flight: Combined handicaps of 13 or more. 
Flights of 16 teams. 
3. Senior Championship: Each member of the team 
must be 55 or older

title: Brockton City Four-Ball Championship
notes:
54-hole four-ball stroke play tournament with a cut 
after 36 holes. Championship and Senior (both 
players 
age 55+) flights. Maximum handicap 9.0.

title: Rochester District Senior Championship
notes:
Entries are open to all amateur male golfers age 55 
and 
over and are members in good standing at RDGA 
clubs. 
Format is 36-holes of stroke play with multiple age 
divisions: Senior (55-59), Super Senior (60-64), 
Masters (65-69), and Legends (70 & Older).

title: World Junior Girls Championship - CANCELLED
notes:
**Cancelled due to the coronavirus outbreak.

First played in 2014, the World Junior Girls Championship features 16 three person teams (two from host Canada). Each team plays a 72-holes of stroke-play and at the end of the final round there are team and individual champions.

title: Little Brown Jug Invitational
notes:
Since 1972, the Little Brown Jug Golf Tournament 
has 
been held annually at Wahconah Country Club in 
Dalton, Massachusetts. With its strong field, “The 
Jug” 
is one of the top 4-Ball events in Western 
Massachusetts. 54-hole four-ball stroke play 
tournament with multiple divisions.

title: French International Ladies Amateur Stroke Play Championship
notes:
54-hole women's stroke play competition open to 
an 
international field.

title: Minnesota Golf Champions
notes:
54 invitational stroke play championship for 
amateurs 
and professionals. Invitations earned by winners and 
high-finishers in major Minnesota tournaments in 
the 
previous year. Championship (overall) and Amateur 
Divisions, plus a Past Masters Division comprised of 
champions of various state tournaments from many 
years ago. Prizes awarded to overall champion, low 
amateur, and Past Masters champion.

title: Asheboro City Amateur - POSTPONED
notes:
**Postponed due to the coronavirus outbreak.

54 hole stroke play championship for residents of Randolph County, North Carolina. City Am Shootout held the day before the event.

title: Buffalo District Mid-Amateur Championship
notes:
Open to all mid-amateur golfers in the seven Western 
New York counties and to BDGA members in the 
Niagara Peninsula of Canada.

title: Schenectady Classic
notes:
54 hole stroke play championship with men's and 
women's divisions (women play 36 holes). This is an 
open tournament; there is no longer a county residency 
requirement.

title: Shenandoah Valley Fall Two-Man Championship
notes:
Flighted two-man tournament, with flights based on 
day one scoring. 27 holes each day: 9 
holes Scramble, 9 holes Best Ball, 9 holes Alternate 
Shot. First place ties in Championship flight resolved by 
a sudden death playoff, using alternate shot.

title: Westchester Open Championship
notes:
18-Hole Sectional Qualifying Round. 54-Hole Stroke 
Play Championship. Field cut after 18 holes to the 
low 40 players plus ties and anyone within 5 strokes 
of the leader. The competition is open to 
amateur members of Westchester Golf Association 
member clubs AND members of an Metropolitan Golf 
Association e-Club that reside in the nine county 
area.

title: Westchester Mid-Amateur Championship
notes:
This event is a two-day 36-Hole Stroke Play 
competition for players ages 30 and up. The 
competition is open to 
amateur members of Westchester Golf Association 
member clubs and members of an Metropolitan Golf 
Association e-Club that reside in the nine county 
area.

title: Steve Welch Fall Classic
notes:
36 hole stroke play tournament in flights, with an 
additional Super Senior division for ages 65 and over.

title: Greensboro National Fall Classic
notes:
36 hole two man best-ball tournament. Prizes: 1/2 Gift 
Certificate and 1/2 Cash Prize Money: $1,000 Purse Per 
Flight (based on 36 teams)

title: Marion Masters Super Seniors Championship
notes:
36 hole stroke play tournament. Must be a full time 
Marion County resident or own property in Marion 
County.

title: The Senior/Junior Invitational
notes:
Teams will consist of two players, one age 18 and up 
(JR) and one age 55 or over (SR). The format is a 
better ball of the team. Prizes will be awarded for both 
gross and net scores.

title: The Ocala Cup
notes:
Two-day four-ball tournament with regular and 
senior 
divisions.

title: Wisconsin Public Links Stroke Play Championship
notes:
36 hole stroke play championship. Flights will be 
determined by the tournament committee according
to the number of entries. Flights will include 
Championship, “A”,
“B” and “C” flights (low gross and low net in “C” 
flight 
only). Must have WSGA handicap index.

title: Ontario Senior Women's Championship
notes:
The Ontario Senior Women's Amateur Championship 
has been contested annually since 1962 and features 
the province's best female amateurs age 50 and over. 
There are also divisions for those aged 60+ and 70+, 
plus a district team championship.

title: British Columbia Women's Amateur Championship
notes:
72-hole stroke play championship with a cut after 36 
holes. Maximum handicap 18.0.

title: The Watermark Cup
notes:
A Ryder Cup-type event for the top 16 West Michigan 
golfers who hail from private and public courses. Public 
team vs. Private team.

title: Western Michigan Districts Tournament
notes:
36 holes of individual stroke play with concurrent 
team 
matches, where teams are comprised of members of 
the same golf club.

title: West Michigan Fall Best Ball/Scramble
notes:
36 Hole tournament, with separate Two-Man Best Ball 
and Scramble competitions.

title: James H. Fyke Municipal Amateur Golf Championship
notes:
The Municipal Amateur Championship was founded in 1981 by Jim Fyke. Modeled after the City Open, it was his vision to create an amateur golf championship that was truly open to all competitors in Nashville and the surrounding areas. 54 hole stroke play championship.

Applications are open to male residents of the Nashville Metropolitan Statistical Area who meet the USGA definition of an amateur golfer. Persons applying for reinstatement to amateur status are not eligible. All competitors must be at least 18 years of age.

The Metropolitan Statistical Area includes:Nashville- Davidson-Murfreesboro-Franklin (Cannon, Cheatham, Davidson, Dickson, Hickman, Macon, Maury, Robertson, Rutherford, Smith, Sumner, Trousdale, Williamson, Wilson)

title: Jefferson City CC Memorial
notes:
36-hole stroke play tournament with Senior (age 50+) 
and Super Senior (age 65+) divisions.

title: Oklahoma Senior Golf Association Fall Medal Play
notes:
36-hole stroke play tournament for OSGA members 
with the following divisions: Championship, ages 50-64, 
65-69, 70-79, 80+. Gross and net competitions.

title: Oklahoma Senior Golf Association Fall Golf Outing
notes:
Day 1 is a two-man flighted best ball competition, while 
day 2 is a flighted individual stroke play competition 
with gross and net competitions within each flight.
courseName: Dornick Hills Golf and Country Club

title: Armitage Best-Ball Tournament
notes:
36 hole better ball of partners tournament, flighted 
after the first round.

title: Chambersburg Fall Classic
notes:
54 hole two-man best-ball tournament, flighted 
after the first round. All male golfers over the age of 
14 
years at the time of the event are eligible.

title: Central Pennsylvania Individual Championship
notes:
36-Hole stroke play championship open to all 
amateur golfers. Players will be placed in flights after 
the first day based on Round 1 gross score. Divisions – 
Men, Senior, Women and Junior

title: Women’s District of Columbia Senior Championship
notes:
The WDCGA Senior Tournament is a 2-day stroke play competition. The winner and runner up are the low gross scores of the entire field. There is a Super Senior and/or a Co- Super Senior award for competitors 65 years of age and older. Special prizes are sponsored by Past President Nancy Graves for the overall low gross winners of the following age brackets: 60-69, 70-79, 80 and over.

The field is divided into flights. Net and gross prizes are awarded in all flights. The Senior Tournament Chair makes the pairings for the first day of play. Pairings on the second day are according to gross scores from the first day of competition.

title: Vermont Women's Mid-Amateur Championship
notes:
36 hole stroke play tournament. All entrants must 
be 
35 years or older at the tournament start. Trophies 
are 
awarded to the overall champion and to the club 
team 
with the lowest score – total of two gross scores and
one net score each day.

title: Wisconsin Senior Open Championship
notes:
36-Hole Stroke Play Competition with a Super Senior (60+) Division. Low gross and low net prizes will be awarded for amateurs.

Open to any legal resident of the state of Wisconsin or a non-resident that resides in the state of Wisconsin for a minimum of three months.

title: Berks County Partners Championship
notes:
This is a two-day, 36-hole stroke play event and may be scheduled Monday through Sunday as appropriate.

Current format:

First Round: Four-ball;
Second Round: Foursome (modified alternate shot). The players shall both play from the teeing ground. They shall cross over and play their partners ball. They shall choose which player’s ball to play and alternate until the ball is holed out.

Note 1: The field will be broken into additional flight(s), depending on the number of entries.

title: Berks County Senior Amateur Championship
notes:
This is a two-day, 36-hole stroke play event. Competition will be by two divisions (Overall and Super Senior) and also in age groups (Overall, 50- 54, 55-59, 60-64, 65-69, 70 & over).

Note 1: The addition of a Super Senior division will be added beginning in 2010. Players, who are 65 years of age and older, will play from adjusted Senior tees.

Note 2: Individuals 65 yrs or older wishing to compete for the ‘Overall’ Championship must check the 60-64 age group and will compete in that age group and from the men’s tees.

title: Hideout Senior Amateur
notes:
36-hole individual stroke play event for seniors. USGA 
Handicap required.

title: TalonsCove Amateur - CANCELLED
notes:
**Cancelled for 2020.

36-hole individual flighted stroke play event with championship, senior and super senior divisions. Gross and net scoring within each flight.

title: Red Rocks Amateur Championship
notes:
36-hole individual flighted stroke play tournament, with 
a blind draw team event with individual sweeps held 
the day before the tournament.

title: Southern Utah Open Championship
notes:
36-hole stroke play championship for professionals 
and 
amateurs, with Championship, Senior and Super 
Senior 
Divisions

title: Moab Senior Amateur Championship
notes:
36 hole stroke play tournament open to men and 
women seniors aged 50 and above. Utah Golf 
Association Senior points event.

title: Arkansas Open Championship
notes:
Stroke play championship for professionals and 
amateurs. Amateurs can play with the professionals in 
the Open Division, or enter one of three amateur 
divisions: Mid-Senior (ages 40+), Senior (ages 50+), 
or Super Senior (ages 65+).
courseName: Burns Park Golf Course - Championship Course

title: Genesee Allstar Classic
notes:
54 hole stroke play championship with Regular, Senior 
and Super Senior divisions. Regular and Senior 
divisions play 36 holes the first day.

title: Henry County Country Club Men's Invitational
notes:
36 hole stroke play with flights determined by 
contestants' handicaps. Championship and First Flights 
play the back tees. Higher flights go off early on day 
two, with the Championship Flight going off last. All 
amateurs must have a current GHIN Handicap Index.

title: Tacoma City Amateur Championship
notes:
This tournament has been held every year since 
1931 
making it one of the longest consecutively-running 
amateur tournaments in the country. The event 
consists of a 54 holes stroke play. Final qualifiers will 
consist of the low 30 scores plus ties after the first 
two 
rounds. Entrants must be a minimum of 16 years old 
and have a maximum handicap of 10.

title: Portage County Senior Amateur Championship
notes:
First played in the 1970s, this is a 36-hole stroke play 
event with Senior (50-59), Senior 
Gold (60-69), Senior Platinum (70+) and Senior 
Women Divisions.

title: City of Aiken Amateur Championship
notes:
36 hole stroke play championship with Regular, 
Senior, 
Super Senior and Ladies divisions, with players 
flighted 
after the first round based on their score. There is 
also 
a two-player team competition featuring players in 
different divisions representing the same golf club.

title: The Schooner Fall Classic
notes:
54-hole women's college 
tournament hosted 
by the University of Oklahoma. Team (best four 
scores 
out of five players each round) and individual 
competitions.

title: Betsy Rawls Longhorn Invitational
notes:
54 hole women's college 
tournament hosted by the University of Texas. Team 
(best four scores out of five players each round) and 
individual competitions.

title: Las Vegas Collegiate Showdown
notes:
54 hole women's college 
tournament hosted by UNLV. Team (best four scores 
out of five players each round) and individual 
competitions.

title: Gaston County Amateur
notes:
54 stroke play tournament with championship, 
senior 
and super senior divisions. Proceeds from the 
tournament benefit Cancer Services of Gaston 
County, 
an organization that serves the community by 
providing 
support and services to people living with cancer.

title: Manchester City Golf Championship
notes:
Started in 1958, this is a 54 hole stroke play 
championship played on three area golf courses, 
with 
the following divisions: Open, Senior (ages 55+), 
Super 
Senior (ages 65+), and Junior (ages 18 and under). 
Open to residents of Manchester, NH and members 
of 
the three host clubs. Max handicap 12.0 (15.0 for 
super 
seniors).

title: Women's Asia-Pacific Amateur Championship
notes:
The inaugural Women's Asia-Pacific Amateur Championship was played in 2018.

It is played over 72-holes stroke play with the field to comprise 86 players. Players are eligible based on their R&A World Amateur Golf Ranking.

It is conducted by the Asia-Pacific Golf Confederation.

The winner receives an invitation to play in the Ricoh Women’s British Open and the ANA Inspiration.

title: Wilson County Amateur Championship
notes:
Also known as the H.W. Weatherford Memorial, the 
Wilson County Amateur is a 36 hole stroke play 
championship for men, women and seniors, flighted 
by 
first-round score.

title: Porter Amateur
notes:
A local Porter County tournament golf tradition since 
1955. The Porter Amateur is played over four rounds 
and aims to identify the best Lady and Gentleman 
Golfer of the year. 72 holes of stroke play held over 
four different courses. Divisions: Master (avg score 80 
or under), Open (avg score 80 or over), Senior (ages 
55-64), Super Senior (ages 65+), and Women. 
FLighted after 36 holes.

title: New Mexico Senior Open Championship
notes:
36 hole stroke play tournament with no cut, open to 
professionals and amateurs ages 50 and older.

title: Taos Amateur Championship - CANCELLED
notes:
**Cancelled due to the coronavirus outbreak.

36 hole stroke play tournament with the following divisions: championship, men’s senior championship, first net, second net and women's.

title: Edmonton Men's Amateur Championship
notes:
Gross and net stroke play championship. Overall Low 
gross 
champion, Low gross senior champion, 3 flights 
including prizing for gross and net in each flight, Long 
Drive Contest, Hole in One Prize/Closest to the pin 
contest.

title: Rogue Valley Stroke Play Championship
notes:
36 hole stroke play championship with the following 
divisions: Championship Division (gross only), 
Men’s Division, 
Men’s Senior Division (55 to 64), 
Men’s Super Senior Division (65 and up), 
Ladies Division. Limited to the first 160 signups.

title: Southern Oregon Golf Championships
notes:
The Southern Oregon Golf Championships is the largest Amateur Match-Play tournament held on a single course in the United States. Each player receives at least four rounds of golf flighted by score and handicap.

Divisions:
Men's Regular - 16 years and up
Men's Junior/Senior - 40 years and up
Men's Senior - 55 years and up
Men's Super Senior - 65 years and up
Men's Legendary - 75 years and up
Women's Regular - 16 years and up
Women's Senior - 55 years and up

title: Schuylkill County Amateur Championship
notes:
36-hole individual stroke play tournament for 
amateurs 
and 
seniors. Flighted after 1st round.
Open to current county residents, former county 
residents, former tournament champions with 
amateur status and any paid members of the 
Schuylkill Country Club or any public course in 
Schuylkill County.

title: Frederick City Amateur Championship - CANCELLED
notes:
**Cancelled due to the coronavirus outbreak.

Two day, 36 hole stroke play tournament flighted by handicap. Open to all amateur golfers holding a current USGA handicap from a PGA recognized facility.

title: Toledo Open
notes:
36 hole stroke play championship open to 
professionals 
and amateurs with a maximum handicap index of 
5.0. 
Field size 132.

title: Chippewa Championship
notes:
The 36-hole Chippewa Championship, the long-
running 
individual stroke play event with a giant skins game, 
parimutuels, team games, great food and much 
more.

title: Berkeley Invitational
notes:
54 hole stroke play tournament hosted by Berkeley 
Country Club with Championship and Men's 
Divisions. 
Has been played annually for over 50 years.

title: Asheville Amateur Tournament
notes:
18 Holes of individual stroke play per day. 36 holes 
total – Flighted by Gross Score after the first day. 
Regular and Senior flights.

title: Florida Winter Series - Indian Springs
notes:
The Florida Winter Series is for players 25 years and 
older. *Gross scoring only**. A Regular or 
Foundation 
Florida State Golf Association membership level is 
required. The field is broken down into three 
divisions 
by age. Mid-Amateur (25-54); Senior (55-64); and 
Super Senior (65 & over) Mid-Senior plays 
approximately 6,700 yards. Senior plays 
approximately 
6,400 yards. Super-Senior approximately 6,100 
yards.

title: Kauai Amateur Championship - CANCELLED
notes:
**Cancelled due to the coronavirus outbreak.

36-hole stroke play championship, with Championship, A, Net, Senior, and Senior Net flights.

title: Texas Women's Pinehurst Tournament
notes:
Eligibility: Entries are open to female amateur golfers with a certified GHIN Handicap Index.

Player Field: The starting field will consist of 50 teams (100 players). Entries will be accepted by entry date then blind draw.

Format: The championship will be 36 holes of Chapman Stroke Play (also known as Pinehurst Format). Two players play as partners, each playing from the teeing ground and each playing her partner’s ball for the second shot. After second shot, partners select ball with which they wish to score and play the ball alternately to complete the hole. The field will be preflighted by combined handicap index.

title: The Cape Cod Cup
notes:
Team matches between an amateur team and the 
Cape 
Cod Section of the New England PGA. Each team 
features 14 players (2 seniors) and play a Nassau 
four-
Ball match play format - with three points up for 
grabs 
per match.

title: Golfweek U.S. Super Senior & Legends National Championship
notes:
Started in 2017, this tournament features the world's 
elite super-senior amateurs (age 65+) and will include 
a separate legends division for those age 70+. Max 
handicap 8.0.
courseName: The Falls Club of The Palm Beaches

title: Florida Mixed Shootout
notes:
The Mixed Shoot-Out doesn't only "mix-up" the teams with one man and one woman, but it includes three different forms of play in its 36 holes of golf. Gift certificates will be awarded to the best gross and net scores for each format of play, as well as the overall total for the championship.

Championship Format
• Maximum of 48 teams; 96 players
• Saturday: 9 holes of scramble format and 9 holes of modified alternate shot (Chapman format)
• Sunday: 18 holes of four-ball stroke play
• All teams will compete for gross and net prizes in each flight.
• The overall champion will be the team (regardless of flight) with the lowest gross total for the competition.

Eligibility
• One entrant must be at least 16 years of age as of the first day of the Championship
• A valid Florida GHIN Handicap Index
• At least one entrant is required to be a member of the FSGA
• Teams must consist of one male and one female
courseName: Verandah Golf Club - Old Orange Course

title: Florida Women's Net Championship
notes:
Championship Format
• 36 holes of individual net stroke play (100% of handicap will be used)
• 96 total competitors - Playing in foursomes
• Two Divisions - Middle and Forward
• Each Division Champion will be the individual with the lowest 36-hole total net score (regardless of pre-flighting)

Eligibility
• Female amateur golfer
• At least 18 years of age as of the first day of the Championship
• A valid Florida GHIN Handicap Index not exceeding 34.0
• Entrants are not required to be a member of the FSGA

title: Carolinas Net Amateur Championship
notes:
The championship is 36 holes of net stroke play using 100% Course Handicap. Net Score is calculated by subtracting Course Handicap from Gross Score. Players select the division in which to compete if eligible:

Men (age 18+); Senior Men (age 55+); Super Senior Men (age 65+); Women (age 18+); Senior Women (age 50+); Super Senior Women (age 65+).

Men age 55+ have the option to compete in the Men’s division. Women age 50+ have the option to compete in the Women’s division.

Players are assigned into flights within divisions by net score following the first round.

Must be at least 18 years of age.

title: Carolinas Super Senior Four-Ball Championship
notes:
The championship is contested at 36 holes of 
four-
ball stroke play. Gross
scores only. Teams select the division in which to 
compete if eligible:
Championship Division (Men Age 65+); 
Approximate 
yardage = 6000
yards.
70+ Division (Both team members age 70+); 
Approximate yardage = 5500
yards.

title: Connecticut Women's Open Championship - CANCELLED
notes:
**Cancelled due to the coronavirus outbreak.

The Connecticut Women's Open Championship is open to any amateur or professional female golfer and is the CSGA's only championship that is open to non- residents of Connecticut. 36 holes stroke play. Amateurs must have a USGA Handicap Index not exceeding 15.0.

title: Gosling's Invitational
notes:
54 hole stroke play championship for professionals 
and 
amateurs. Exemptions are 
given to amateurs including for the U.S. Mid-Amateur 
champion.

title: Utah Women's Senior Stroke Play Championship
notes:
Eligibility: All female members of the UGA age 50+ who have a Handicap with the UGA as of the registration deadline

Format: 36 hole individual stroke play. Gross and Net winners will be awarded.

title: Arizona Women's Open
notes:
54 hole stroke play championship for professionals and 
amateurs with no cut.

title: Louisiana Net Amateur Championship
notes:
Play will consist of 36 holes net stroke play. Field will be divided into flights based on USGA Handicap Indexes. Number of flights determined by size of field. The Overall Champion may come from any flight and will be the competitor that returns the low 36 hole net score. Scores will be calculated by subtracting COURSE HANDICAP from GROSS SCORE.

Participants may also elect to play in the concurrent Net Club Team Championship. Teams shall consist of four members of the same LGA Member Club or Association. Club's Team score shall be calculated by counting the best three of four scores for each day's play. Winning Club will be determined by low total after 36 holes and will receive Club Team Championship trophy (Club may be represented by only three members but three scores must be counted per day). Scores will be calculated by subtracting COURSE HANDICAP from GROSS SCORE.

title: Mississippi Women's Senior Amateur Championship
notes:
Tournament is scheduled for 36 holes of stroke play. 
Field size is limited to the first 96 players. The 
Championship is open to female amateurs who have 
reached their 50th birthday and are residents of the 
state of Mississippi.

title: Carolinas Women's Club Team Championship
notes:
Each club will enter two, two-woman sides each day. Each side of two will play an 18-hole qualifying round in a four-ball stroke play format on the first day of competition. The four clubs with the four lowest aggregate scores will be placed in the Championship Flight. All other clubs will be flighted into flights of four club teams by team Handicap Index and seeded by aggregate qualifying score. Club team winners for each flight will be determined by two days of fourball match play (one point per hole). Teams losing their first round match will be placed in a consolation match.

Players must be at least 13 years old, legal residents of North Carolina or South Carolina, and members in good standing of a club which is a member of the Carolinas Golf Association

title: Virginia Mixed Four-Ball Tournament
notes:
18-hole four-ball stroke play competition with gross 
and net prizes. Each side must have one male and 
one 
female player. Open to male and female golfers of 
all 
ages. Participants must hold an active GHIN number 
issued by a licensed VSGA Member Club in good 
standing.

title: Virginia Junior Four-Ball Championship
notes:
Open to VSGA juniors ages 19 and under, except 
any 
junior who has graduated from high school may only 
participate until August 31st of their graduation 
year. 
Format consists of 36 holes of four-ball stroke play.

title: California Seniors Golf Association Four-Ball Championship
notes:
36-hole four-ball stroke play competition for seniors 
who are 
members of the California Seniors' Golf Association. 
The maximum field of 120 players will be divided into
four equal flights according to the combined 
handicaps
of each team. There will be four flights: 
Championship,
Presidents, Cypress and Mission flight. All flights will 
use
Gross/Net Stroke Play Scoring.

title: Minnesota Net Amateur Championship
notes:
36-hole net stroke play event for Minnesota amateur 
golfers with Men's and Women's divisions.
courseName: The Pines At Grand View Lodge

title: Texas Shamble
notes:
2 Person Shamble (Flighted).  Mixed, Male and Female 
Flights.  Net and Gross prizes.  80% of each players 
handicap will be used.

title: Iowa Wife-Husband Championship
notes:
Participants must legally be husband and wife,
and maintain a residence in the state of Iowa. 36-
hole 
modified alternate shot tournament with 
Championship 
and Super Senior (130 combined years) divisions.

title: Florida Men's Net Championship
notes:
Championship Format
• 36 Holes of Net Individual Stroke Play
• Maximum 96 player field size
• All players will play to 100% of their lowest index (LI) for the previous 12 months
• Players must play in their respective age division

Eligibility
• Must be a male amateur member of the FSGA
• Must have a valid Florida GHIN handicap of under 24.0.
• Must be 18 years of age or older by the first day of the Championship.
• Must have played in at least 3 One-Day events in the current calendar year as of the close of entries.
• Entries will be processed after your 3rd event is complete and a score is registered, first come first serve.
courseName: Mission Inn Resort - El Campeon Course

title: Florida Senior Two-Man Shootout - CANCELLED
notes:
**Cancelled for 2020.

Two-man teams will compete in three rounds of gross scoring. On the first day, teams will play 18 holes of a two-man scramble and 18 holes of alternate shot. The final day, round three, will be 18 holes of four-ball. Entrants must both be members of the FSGA.

title: Florida Men's Net Four-Ball Championship
notes:
Teams of two play in the Four-Ball 
Championship of 36 holes of net stroke play. Entrants 
must both be 
members of the FSGA. Three age divisions: Under 50, 
50-64, and 65+.

title: Florida Foursomes Championship
notes:
Teams of two play in the Foursomes 
Championship of 36 holes of alternate shot stroke play. 
Two divisions: Championship and Senior (both players 
ages 55+). Entrants 
must both be 
members of the FSGA.
courseName: Lakewood Ranch Golf and Country Club - Royal Lakes Course

title: Manatee Amateur Golf Classic
notes:
36 hole stroke play (flighted). Open to all male 
amateurs with a USGA established handicap or play at 
zero.
Senior division championship flight players must be 50 
years or older. (Minimum age 16)

title: Carolinas Senior Four-Ball Tournament of Champions
notes:
Tournament format is 36 holes of flighted four-ball 
stroke play, gross and net
scores. According to USGA handicap procedures, 90 
percent of a player's course handicap is used to
determine net scores. Must be a CGA 
member.

title: Southern California Senior Women's Amateur Championship
notes:
The premier SCGA senior women's championship is 
contested over two days and 36 holes. This 
championship is open to female SCGA members of 
all 
skill levels. Players will have the option of competing 
in 
either the gross or net division, as we aim to identify 
Southern California’s top female senior golfers. 
Senior 
Women’s Amateur entrants must have reached their 
50th birthday by the first day of the championship.

title: Southern California Public Links Net Championship - CANCELLED
notes:
**Cancelled due to the coronavirus outbreak.

The Public Links Net Championship is open to all amateurs who are members of a SCGA club (public or affiliate) who have a current index as of the date of registration and do not have playing privileges, a membership or a handicap index at a course or club which the general public is excluded. This championship is a 36-hole individual net stroke play event.

title: Southern California Four-Ball Net Championship
notes:
Partners representing a club must be members of 
the 
same SCGA member club. Up to two teams can 
represent each member club. This event is open 
to all 
skill levels however all participants with an index 
of 
18.4 and above will play down to an 18.4. 
Qualifying is 
18 holes of four-ball net stroke play. 52 teams will 
advance to the championship which consists of 36 
holes 
of four-ball net stroke play.

title: Southern California Women's Tournament of Club Champions
notes:
Women’s club champions are invited to play in this 
18-hole event. The club championship is open to all 
skill levels. They must be an amateur member in 
good standing with the SCGA and a member on the 
club’s active roster at the time they won the 
championship. This Division will compete without 
handicaps.

title: Northern California Women's Net Amateur Championship - CANCELLED
notes:
**Cancelled in 2020.

Originally a part of the NCGA Women’s Championship, which began in 2005, the Women’s Net Championship has stood on its own since 2008. Players are divided into three flights based on Handicap Index: President (7.5-14.4), Director (14.5-20.5) and Secretary (20.6 & above). 36 holes stroke play (18 holes per day). Play will be at 100% of course handicap. Open to all NCGA female members with a numeric handicap index on their club’s Master Report on the date of registration.

title: Northern California Two-Person Scramble
notes:
The championship will be 36 holes of stroke play (18 
holes per day) in a Scramble format. Teams will be 
re-paired by score, within their flight, for the second 
round. Play will be 35% of the lower Course 
Handicap and 15% of the higher Course Handicap. 
Both players must be NCGA Members and have a 
current numeric Handicap Index on their club’s 
Master Report on the date of registration. Partners 
need not be members of the same club.

title: Senior Oregon Open Invitational
notes:
**For 2020 this is a 36-hole tournament.

54 hole stroke play championship for professionals and amateurs, with no cut.

title: Western Pennsylvania Senior Four-Ball Championship
notes:
Four-Ball is the most common form of play 
in western Pennsylvania. Originally open only to 
teams with members from the same 
Member Club, the event is now open to 
any players who reside in the western 
Pennsylvania district who meet handicap 
eligibility. The championship is thirty-six 
holes.

title: Indianapolis Open Championship
notes:
36-hole stroke play championship open to 
professionals 
and amateurs with a handicap index not exceeding 
6.4.

title: Jimmy Creed Junior Boys' Invitational
notes:
36-hole stroke play tournament open to boys ages 
13-18 from NC and SC who have a USGA Handicap 
Index of 15.0 or lower. Boys compete in three age 
divisions (13-14, 15-16, 17-18).

title: Connecticut Mixed Team Championship
notes:
This Championship celebrated its 80th playing in 
2017 
and is contested over 18-holes in a Chapman format. 
In the Chapman format, both players on a team tee 
off, 
they then play each others tee shot for the second 
shot, select one of the second shots and from that 
point that ball is played alternately until holed. Male 
partner's handicap cannot exceed 20.0 and female 
partner's handicap cannot exceed 30.0.

title: Massachusetts Women's Stroke Play Championship
notes:
36-hole stroke play championship for women amateurs 
with an established GHIN handicap from a 
Massachusetts 
Golf Association member 
club. Max handicap 18.
courseName: The Country Club At New Seabury - Ocean Course

title: Grace Keyes Cup
notes:
36-hole stroke play championship for women 
mid-amateurs 
with an established GHIN handicap from a 
Massachusetts 
Golf Association member 
club. Two Divisions: Keyes Division (max handicap 18) 
and Flighted Division (handicaps of 18.1-36.0).

title: Endicott Cup and Women's Tri-State Matches
notes:
The Endicott Cup is a 36-hole individual stroke 
play 
championship for women golfers from 
Massachusetts, 
Connecticut and Rhode Island. The Tri-State 
Matches 
immediately follow, with each state selecting a 
gross 
and net team from Endicott Cup participants, and 
playing individual match play.

title: Sheeran Trophy
notes:
Spousal foursomes tournament, with teams of 2 
playing 18-hole Mixed Foursomes, selected drives, 
alternate shot, 40% of combined handicaps.
One spouse must have an established GHIN handicap 
from a Massachusetts Golf Association member 
club. Open to players with a handicap index of 24.0 or 
less.

title: Uniting Nations Cup, USA vs. Mexico Match Play Challenge
notes:
Friendly Ryder Cup style team matches between the 
USA and Mexico in 
a three-day fun, casual event for all 
skill levels. Foursomes (best ball), four ball (modified 
alternate shot), and singles matches. Each 
association can enter as many two-person teams as 
they wish. Open to men and women amateur golfers 
from the United States and Mexico with a 
verifiable Handicap Index.

title: John A. Burns Challenge Cup
notes:
Established in 1973 by the second governor of Hawaii, 
the John A. Burns Challenge Cup is the most 
prestigious team competition between the amateur and 
professional associations in Hawaii. Amateur team 
determined by points gained through performance in 
Hawaii events throughout the season.

title: Colorado Super Senior Match Play Championship
notes:
32-layer match play bracket for super seniors (ages 
60+), with seeding 
index determined by handicap index. The defending 
champion will be the 
#1 seed.

title: Fox Hill Invitational
notes:
36-hole stroke play tournament. CGA Player of the Year 
Points will be awarded to the Championship and Senior 
Championship flights. The senior flight, age 50+, will 
be gross scoring only. Juniors may play in the 
championship flight only.

title: Aurora City Amateur Championship
notes:
36-hole stroke play tournament. CGA Player of the Year 
Points will be awarded to the Championship and Senior 
Championship flights. The senior flight, age 50+, will 
be gross scoring only.

title: Colorado Women's Dunham Chapman Championship
notes:
36 holes of Chapman Stroke Play – Two players play 
as partners, each playing from the teeing ground 
and 
each playing their partner’s ball for the second shot. 
After the second shot, partners select the ball with 
which they wish to score, and play that ball 
alternately to complete the hole. Teams are pre-
flighted according to their combined adjusted course 
handicap (based on the September 1 revision) with 
approximately 8 teams per flight.

title: Wyoming Mid-Amateur Match Play Championship - CANCELLED
notes:
**Cancelled for 2020.

18-hole stroke play round to determine various brackets for match play. Men's and women's, gross and net competitions.

title: California State Fair Junior Championship
notes:
One-day stroke play tournament for boys and girls with the following age divisions: Boys 16-18, Boys 14-15, Boys 12-13, Boys under 12, Girls.

The tournament will be 18 holes of stroke play on the Alister MacKenzie course for ages 12-18, and 9 holes on the Arcade Creek course for ages 7- 11.

title: West Virginia Two-Person Scramble
notes:
Entries are open to male amateur golfers with an 
active GHIN Handicap index through a WVGA 
Member 
Club. The championship will be a 36-hole Two-
Person 
Scramble Event, with Championship, Senior and 
Ladies 
divisions.

title: Georgia Senior Tour Championship
notes:
Open to all Professionals and Amateurs who live 
in the state of Georgia and are age 50 or older. 
Senior 
and Super Senior divisions.

title: Virginia Multi-Format Team Championship
notes:
36-hole two-person team tournament playing two-
person scramble and modified alternate shot (18 holes 
of each). The field will be comprised of a maximum of 
50 sides (100 players), 25 sides in the open division 
and 25 sides in the senior (ages 50+) division. 
Participants must hold an active GHIN number issued 
by a licensed VSGA Member Club in good standing and 
meet the USGA Rules of Amateur Status.

title: Florida Southwest Amateur Series (August)
notes:
Flights:
Championship flight - players with handicaps of +3.0 to 3.8
Senior Championship flight - Ages 50 and over with Indexes of +3.0 to 3.8
First flight - players with handicaps of 3.9 to 8.9
Second Flight - players with handicaps of 9.0 to 14.0

Each flight must have a minimum of six players or the flights may be combined. Gross Flights excluded.

Format:
Individual stroke play within flights
The Championship flight will play gross stroke play, the other two flights will play a net The First flight and the Second flight may be combined and play will be handicapped (a net game) for those players.

Membership & Eligibility:
Male, amateur golfers with an active FSGA/GHIN handicap (14.0 or less)

title: Michigan Senior Tournament of Champions
notes:
18-hole stroke play tournament open to Senior Men 
and 
Women who have won their GAM Club Championship 
or 
a GAM Championship in the current year.

title: Michigan Net Amateur Championship
notes:
36-hole net stroke play championship open to men 
with 
handicaps of 20.4 or lower. Sectional qualifiers held 
the 
month prior to the championship.

title: Michigan Senior Net Amateur Championship
notes:
36-hole net stroke play championship open to senior 
men with 
handicaps of 20.4 or lower. Sectional qualifiers held 
the 
month prior to the championship.

title: Michigan Publinx Medal Play Championship
notes:
54 hole tournament (27 holes played on Saturday, 
27 
holes played on Sunday) with Championship, Senior 
Championship and Net competitions. Seniors are 
ages 
50 and older. Entries are open to all male amateur 
golfers with an established USGA handicap 
(maximum 
16 for the Net division). Must be eighteen years or 
older to participate.

title: Oregon Net Championship
notes:
36-hole stroke play net competition with flights 
determined by handicap. Entries in the 
Men’s Division are open to amateur golfers with 
USGA Handicap Indexes of 36.4 and 
less. Entries in the Women’s Division are open to 
female amateur golfers with USGA 
Handicap Indexes of 40.4 and less. All entrants must 
be members in good standing of 
an OGA Member Club.

title: Northern California Senior Four-Ball Net Championship
notes:
First played in 1999, the NCGA Senior Four-Ball Net Championship is a two-person, better-ball handicap event for all senior NCGA members.

Format: Four-Ball Stroke Play (Two-Person Better Ball). Sectional Qualifying – 18 holes. Championship – 36 holes, 18 holes per day. All play will be 90% (men) and 95% (women) of the course handicap using a maximum handicap index of 18.4 for calculation. All players with handicap indexes of 18.5 and above are eligible but must play to a maximum handicap index of 18.4. If partners’ course handicaps differ by more than 8 strokes, an additional 10 percent reduction will be applied to their course handicaps.

title: Dothan Country Club Men's Invitational
notes:
54-hole stroke play tournament sanctioned as an 
Alabama Golf Association points event.

title: Stockbridge Trophy
notes:
36-hole four-ball stroke play tournament, with Divisions 
determined by first-round score. A maximum of 84 
teams are accepted for the tournament on a first-come, 
first-serve basis.

title: Eagle Mountain Stroke Play Championship
notes:
36-hole stroke play championship with five divisions: 
Championship, Mid-Senior (ages 40 & older), Senior 
(ages 53 & older), Super Senior (ages 63 & older) and 
Masters (ages 70 & older). Arkansas State Golf 
Association points event.

title: Wisconsin Women’s Senior Four-Ball Championship
notes:
Entry is open to all female senior amateur golfers with 
a current WSGA handicap index. Format is 36-holes of 
flighted four-ball stroke play over two days.

title: Roosevelt Invitational
notes:
36-hole stroke play championship, with flights 
determined by handicap.

title: Rhode Island Senior Four-Ball Net Championship
notes:
36-hole stroke play championship with net scoring. 
Eligibility: Age 55 & over. Member of 
RIGA member club.

title: Arrigo Alfa Romeo FIAT Classic
notes:
The event will consist of a 36-hole Four-Ball Stroke 
Play 
Championship (two person teams), played over two 
days. Open, senior and super senior divisions. 
Approximately 40 teams will tee-it-up and 
compete in a Better Ball format. Conducted by the 
Palm 
Beach County Golf Association.

title: Lexington City Team Championship
notes:
This 36-hole tournament is open to men who reside 
in 
Fayette County, Kentucky or hold a membership at a 
Fayette County golf club. The first round will be 
chapman alternate shot and best ball, with the 
second 
round a scramble and combined gross. Open 
Division, a 
Century Division (for teams with combined age 
above 
100) and Legend Division (for teams with combined 
age above 120).

title: Wally Boughton Senior Open
notes:
36 stroke play event for seniors
played at scratch. Flighted by handicap index.

title: Delaware Senior Four-Ball Championship
notes:
Four-ball stroke play tournament open to male senior 
amateur golfers.

title: Ohio Women's Stroke Play Championship
notes:
36 holes of stroke play, with prizes for overall 
champion, low Senior (ages 50-59) and low Super 
Senior (age 60 and over). Flights will be determined by 
total number of entrants and based on first round
scores. Entrants must be residents of Ohio.
courseName: Salt Fork State Park Golf Course

title: Arkansas Women's Four-Ball Championship
notes:
36 hole four-ball  stroke play championship with flights 
and gross and net competitions. Must be an Arkansas 
State Golf 
Association member.
courseName: Red Apple Inn and Country Club

title: Central Illinois Women's Championship
notes:
54-hole stroke play championship for women held on 
three different courses in the Peoria, Illinois area.

title: Berkeley Senior Invitational
notes:
36 hole stroke play tournament hosted by Berkeley 
Country Club with flights (with ten players in each 
flight) determined by first-round score. Field limited to 
the first 108 entries.

title: Ohio Senior Memorial Championship - CANCELLED
notes:
**Cancelled due to the coronavirus outbreak.

36-hole stroke play championship open to all all Ohio male amateur golfers ages 50 years and older before the tournament date.

title: The Wichita Shootout
notes:
36-hole two-man shamble tournament. Both players 
tee off each 
hole. For the second stroke on each hole, one of the 
two balls is 
selected. The ball selected is played out as it lies by 
the player to 
whom the ball belongs. The other player drops or 
places within one 
club-length (if through the green or in a hazard, the 
ball is dropped) 
or on the exact spot (if on the putting green), not 
nearer the hole, of 
the position of the ball selected (for the second 
stroke) and plays out 
the hole with that ball. The player whose ball is 
selected IS NOT 
REQUIRED to hit first, but his ball MUST NOT be 
moved or marked 
(unless on the putting green), if he does not hit first. 
The position of 
the ball may not be improved from the rough to 
fairway, from fringe 
to putting green or to outside of a hazard (including 
bunkers). The 
team’s score for the hole is the lowest number of 
strokes taken 
between the two balls in play (as in Four-Ball). If one 
player fails to 
complete a hole, there is no penalty.

title: Triad Golf Today Tournament of Champions
notes:
36-hole stroke play tournament open to amateur and club champions from the Triad Golf Today circulation area and winners of other qualifying tournaments of at least two days by players from Triad clubs. Open, Senior (ages 55+) and Super Senior (ages 65+) divisions. A Carolina Golf Association (CGA) points event.

Concurrent interclub challenge competition: Each club champion is invited to bring a team consisting of himself and three other amateur club members or association members. The team can be composed of any combination of regulars and seniors. Format is total of the best two front-nine scores and the best two back-nine scores each day.

title: New Hampshire Fall Four-Ball Championship
notes:
Tournament is 18 holes stroke play, 2-man
best-ball with gross and net scoring. Entries 
are open to male amateurs with an active New 
Hampshire GHIN Handicap.

title: New Hampshire Women's Mid-Amateur Championship
notes:
36-holes flighted stroke play. 18-holes per day with 
no 
cut. Open to female golfers with an active New 
Hampshire GHIN Handicap Index. Players must be 
25 
years of age or older as of the first day of the 
tournament.

title: New Hampshire Mid-Amateur Team Championship
notes:
36 holes stroke play. 18-holes Best Ball, 18 holes 
Pinehurst Alternate Shot. Gross and Net 
competitions. 
Open to teams of two male golfers with an active 
New 
Hampshire GHIN Handicap. Each player must be at 
least 25 years of age as of the start of the 
tournament.

title: Kentucky Women's Senior Amateur Championship
notes:
36-hole stroke play championship. The tournament is 
open to all women 55 years and older who are legal 
residents of Kentucky. There are five flights based on 
age. Freshmen: 55-59; Sophomore: 60-64; Junior: 65-
69; Senior: 70-74; Super Senior: 75 and above.

title: Gary Braughton Four-Ball Invitational
notes:
36-hole four-ball stroke play invitational hosted by Ol' 
Colony Golf Club in Tuscaloosa.

title: Ol' Colony Invitational
notes:
36-hole stroke play invitational hosted by Ol' Colony 
Golf Club in Tuscaloosa.

title: Fort Worth Two-Person Best Ball Championship - CANCELLED
notes:
**Cancelled due to the coronavirus outbreak.

36 hole stroke play – Gross/Net Best Ball in each flight. Flighted by lowest USGA Handicap of the two team members. Open to amateurs ages 18 and over by the start of the tournament.
courseName: Pecan Valley Golf Course - River Course

title: Dave Williams Two-Man Best-Ball
notes:
36-hole four-ball stroke play tournament played at both 
courses at Gold Mountain Golf Club. Handicap 
Differential Maximum 
of 8 strokes between players; teams may register with 
greater differential. Those teams will receive handicap 
adjustment to the higher handicap.
courseName: Gold Mountain Golf Course - Olympic Course

title: The Classic
notes:
The Classic is a 36 hole event that will be played using 
Modified Stableford scoring. The Classic will be 
contested in both Open and Senior Divisions. This 
championship is also an IGA Player of
the Year point event where points will be awarded for 
the Open Division players, Senior Division (50+) and
Super Senior Division (65+).

title: La Purisima Masters
notes:
Two-man best-ball tournament open to the public. 
Host course, La Purisima, 
is 
located on California's Central Coast just outside of 
Lompoc, California. The course is known 
for 
its fair but rigorous test of pure golf that has 
challenged PGA Tour Qualifiers and earned a spot on 
Golf Magazine's Top 100 Places to Play in the United 
States. It is the only course in California between 
Monterey and Simi Valley to be named to this 
prestigious list.

title: Ute Creek Invitational - CANCELLED
notes:
**Cancelled due to the coronavirus outbreak.

36-hole individual stroke play tournament with Championship and Senior divisions, as well as Regular Flights determined by most recent USGA handicap. Colorado Cup points event.

title: Highland Hills Amateur Open
notes:
36-hole individual stroke play tournament with 
Championship and Senior (ages 50+) divisions, as well 
as Regular 
Flights determined by most recent USGA handicap. 
Handicap limit of 2.0 for the Championship division.
Colorado Cup points event.

title: Wellshire Four-Ball
notes:
54-hole four-ball stroke play tournament with 
Championship and Senior 
flights. The senior flight is for players ages 50 and 
older. Played for the 75th time in 2018.

title: Estes Park Labor Day Tournament
notes:
Individual stroke play tournament with 
Championship and Senior divisions, as well as Regular 
Flights determined by most recent USGA handicap. 
Colorado Cup points event.

title: Staten Island Fall Net Classic
notes:
Two-man net tournament with a different format each 
day. Round one is a front nine Scramble and back nine 
Pinehurst (20% combined handicap), round two is a 
Best-ball (80% individual handicap), and round three is 
Aggregate Stroke Play (100% individual handicap). 
Tournament is held over consecutive weekends.

title: Greater Kalamazoo Fall Medal
notes:
The GKGA Fall Medal is a two-day individual 36 hole 
scratch medal tournament. There is a Senior Division 
(50 years of age and older) and Open Division.

title: Provo Open Championship
notes:
54-hole stroke play championship for professionals 
and 
amateurs, with a cut to the low 40 pros and low 40 
ams after two rounds. A one-day amateur 
tournament 
is held the day prior to the start of the 
championship; 
18 holes stroke play flighted by handicap.

title: Dixie Amateur
notes:
36-hole stroke play championship held at Dixie 
Red 
Hills Golf Club in southwest Utah. One division for 
players of all handicaps.

title: The Ledges Senior Amateur
notes:
The Ledges Senior Amateur is a 36-hole stroke play 
tournament with gross and net payouts. A Utah Golf 
Association Senior points event.

title: Golfweek Amateur Tour National Championship
notes:
54-hole stroke play season-ending championship of the Golfweek Amateur Tour.

The top players in all of the Local Tours around the country, based on the points earned during the season, are awarded the opportunity to compete in the National Tour Championship. Players finishing the season in the top ten points standings (and ties) in the Champ & D Flights and the top 15 points standings in the A, B & C Flights of their Local Tour qualify for the National Tour Championship. To be eligible for the Tour National Championship, players must have competed and returned valid scores for at least least 4 tournament rounds.

The Tour Championship is held in Hilton Head, SC, and draws over 800 players from around the country.

title: Golfweek Senior Amateur Tour National Championship
notes:
36-hole stroke play season-ending championship of the Golfweek Senior Amateur Tour.

The top fifteen players in each Local Tour around the country, based on the points earned during the season, are awarded the opportunity to compete in the National Tour Championship. To be eligible for the Tour National Championship, players must have competed and returned valid scores for at least 50% of their Local Tour events (can include make up tournaments).

The Tour Championship is held in Hilton Head, SC, and draws over 300 players from around the country.

title: Goodyear Two-Man Invitational
notes:
Two-man tournament with flights determined by 
first-
round scores. The format for day 1 is a Two-Man 
Best-
Ball, with a Texas Scramble on day two.

title: Marvin Crowder Two Ball Tournament
notes:
36-hole two-man tournament with Men's and Senior 
Men's divisions. Day one is a two-man Best-Ball and 
day two is a Scramble.

title: NCCGA Fall National Championship
notes:
The National Collegiate Club Golf Association 
(NCCGA) 
runs competitive weekend college golf 
tournaments for students during the Fall and Spring 
semesters. The NCCGA Fall National 
Championship features 27 of the best club golf 
teams, 
as well as 8 individuals representing their 
schools. The tournament will be a 2-day, 36-hole 
stroke 
play event.

title: City Tour Championship
notes:
National championship of the City Tour, which runs 
team-based golf tournaments for amateur golfers in 
major cities. Each team has 2–3 pairs, and there are 
Four-Ball and Scramble divisions. Must qualify for 
this 
championship through performance in various local 
City 
Tour events.

title: Lebanon County Better-Ball Championship
notes:
36-hole four-ball stroke play event played in Lebanon 
County, Pennsylvania. Open to 
county residents and past county residents (for a year 
or more).

title: Liz Murphey Collegiate Classic
notes:
Women's college tournament hosted by the 
University of Georgia. Team (best four out of five scores 
each round) and individual competitions.

title: Bordas & Bordas Amateur Golf Classic
notes:
Long known as the Bernhardt’s Amateur, this event 
has 
been held at Oglebay since the 1930s. 2-Day
Amateur Partner event that
includes both an Individual
Medal & Best Ball
Competition. Four individual medal divisions: 
Championship, First, Senior (ages 50+) and Super 
Senior (65+).

title: Donald Ross Invitational Better Ball
notes:
The Donald Ross Invitational is the premiere better 
ball 
of partners tournament in eastern Pennsylvania. 36 
hole flighted four-ball stroke play tournament, with 
regular and senior (both players age 50+) divisions.

title: Northeast Pennsylvania Match Play Championship
notes:
Flighted match play tournament with regular, senior, 
and super senior divisions. 18 hole stroke play 
qualifying determines match play brackets in each 
division and flight.

title: Lehigh Valley Tournament of Champions
notes:
36-hole stroke play tournament with regular, 
senior, and super senior divisions. Entry is based on 
performance in various Lehigh Valley tournaments 
throughout the season.

title: Florida Southwest Amateur Series (September)
notes:
Flights:
Championship flight - players with handicaps of +3.0 to 3.8
Senior Championship flight - Ages 50 and over with Indexes of +3.0 to 3.8
First flight - players with handicaps of 3.9 to 8.9
Second Flight - players with handicaps of 9.0 to 14.0

Each flight must have a minimum of six players or the flights may be combined. Gross Flights excluded.

Format:
Individual stroke play within flights
The Championship flight will play gross stroke play, the other two flights will play a net The First flight and the Second flight may be combined and play will be handicapped (a net game) for those players.

Membership & Eligibility:
Male, amateur golfers with an active FSGA/GHIN handicap (14.0 or less)

title: Chattanooga TPC and Senior TPC Golf Tournament - CANCELLED
notes:
**Cancelled for 2020.

Match play tournament for amateurs and seniors. 18 holes of stroke play qualifying will be held, with the qualifiers joining exempt players in the match play brackets.

title: Heron Ridge Fall Classic
notes:
36-hole stroke play tournament, pre-flighted 
by handicap. Gross and Net prizes awarded in each 
flight.

title: Sleepy Hole Two-Man Classic
notes:
36-hole two-man best-ball event with flights based on 
handicap. Flights will depend on the number of teams. 
Gross and Net in the last flight. Open to all amateurs 
with a verifiable handicap.

title: King & Bear Fall Tournament
notes:
36-hole two-man event, open to all 
golfers with a valid USGA handicap. One round on the 
Nicklaus Course, one on the Palmer Course. First round 
two-man sccramble, second round Chapman. Pre-
flighted based on handicap index.

title: CasaBlanca II-Man Golf Tournament
notes:
54-hole two-man tournament played over three courses with a different format each day:

Day 1: Scramble
Day 2: Best Ball
Day 3: Alternate Shot modified

Gross and Net divisions.

title: Collins Cup
notes:
36-hole two-man best-ball stroke play tournament, 
flighted based on first round score.

title: Bellingham Amateur Championship
notes:
36-hole Stroke Play Championship with divisions for 
Men, Women, and Senior Men age 50 and older. Gross 
and Net Champion in each Division. The 
field will be limited to the first 112 paid golfers.
courseName: Sudden Valley Golf and Country Club

title: Vancouver Open
notes:
A full field of 224 golfers, including 144 amateurs and 80 Golf Professionals, will compete in this 54-hole stroke play event.

The event is open to all Amateurs with current Golf Canada or USGA Handicap Factor of 18.0 or less and VGT, PGA of Canada, Mackenzie Tour Canada Professionals and "Mini-Tour" Professionals who will compete in the following divisions:

- Four Amateur Flights (including a Senior Open flight)
- Women's Open Division (Professionals & Amateurs with 8.0 hdcp or less)
- Male Professional Division

title: Mississippi Mixed Team Championship
notes:
The State Mixed Team Championship is scheduled for 36 holes of 2-person scramble. The format of this event is a 2 -person scramble, teams must have 1 male and 1 female player. Teams will be flighted after 18 holes of play.

This championship is open to teams comprised of 1 male and 1 female player. Amateurs must be bona fide residents of Mississippi for at least 60 days prior to the first round of the championship. Competitors are required to have an active GHIN Handicap through a USGA Licensed Mississippi Club. All must conform with the USGA Rules of Amateur Status.

title: Queensland Amateur Championship
notes:
This match play tournament is preceded by the 72-hole 
Queensland Stroke Play Championship, from which the 
low 16 players advance to the match play stage.

title: South Carolina Women's Match Play Championship
notes:
Match play tournament with brackets of a maximum 
of 8 players. Last year's 
Champion will have the first seed in the 
Championship flight. Any player with an 
index of 5.0 or below must play in the Championship 
flight regardless of age. Any 
player regardless of index may sign up to play in the 
Championship flight. There 
is also a State Division for those who wish to sign up 
for shorter tees. State 
Division players will be flighted by handicap index 
and all flights will consist of a 
maximum of 8 players. All players that get 
eliminated from match play 
championship will be able to play in a Par-3 Criers 
Tournament.

title: Maridoe Collegiate Invitational
notes:
54-hole men's college tournament hosted by the 
University of North Texas. Team (best four scores out of 
five players) and individual competitions.

title: New Jersey Women's Four-Ball Championship
notes:
18-hole four-ball stroke play (Better Ball of Partners) 
championship that is open to female amateur 
golfers. Handicap Allocation: Each Team member 
receives 95% of her Course Handicap for Net 
scoring. Entrant must have an ACTIVE and 
VALID USGA Handicap Index
of 30.0 or less through a NJSGA Member Club, which 
is in good standing with the NJSGA, and must 
appear 
on that
club’s Official Handicap Roster.

title: Florida Women's Senior Match Play Championship
notes:
Championship Format
- Individual match play with consolation flights for all divisions
- Championship division will play gross match play
- Middle and Forward divisions will play net match play
- The Championship Division will be seeded by an 18 hole stroke play seeding round
0 - Middle and Forward Divisions will be pre-flighted and seeded by Handicap Index
- Maximum of 64 players
Eligibility
- Female amateur golfer
- At least 50 years of age as of the first day of the Championship
- A valid Florida GHIN Handicap Index not exceeding 34.0
- Entrant is required to be a member of the FSGA

title: Carolinas Club Championship
notes:
The Carolinas Club Championship is conducted at 18 
holes of four-ball stroke play. Entry is open to any 
male or female amateur golfer, as well as Club 
Professional, who is a legal resident of North Carolina 
or South Carolina. Teams may be comprised of a) A 
male or female golf professional who is a member of 
the club’s golf professional staff employed by a 
Carolinas Golf Association (CGA) Member Club and a 
male or female amateur golfer who is a member in 
good standing of the same CGA Member Club. b) 
Two amateur golfers, male or female, who are 
members in good standing of the same CGA Member 
Club. Only two team entries are allowed per member 
club.

title: Coastal Alabama Couples Classic
notes:
54-hole two-person scramble (no handicap) 
tournament played over three courses on the Alabama 
coast. It is an all-inclusive tournament whose entry fee 
includes 3 days of golf, breakfast and lunch daily, a 
welcome reception, a sunset cruise, two drink tickets 
per day and prizes. The tournament will be limited to 
50 teams. Entries are on a first come basis until the 
event is full.

title: Louisiana Women's Senior Championship
notes:
36 hole individual stroke play event for women seniors, 
with flights in each division 
determined by handicap.

title: Northern California Women's Two-Person Scramble II
notes:
36-hole two-person scramble event with A, B, and C 
flights. Entrant must be a member of WGANC and a 
member of the 18-hole women’s group at her club.
USGA handicap index: 34.4 maximum.

title: Alabama State Mixed Team Championship - CANCELLED
notes:
**Cancelled for 2020.

One of Alabama's newest state championships, having started in 2019. Each player must be a legal resident of Alabama and a member in good standing of a club which is a member of the Alabama Golf Association (AGA) and have an active GHIN USGA Handicap Index ® at an AGA member club or is a golf professional employed at an AGA member club. A side is eligible if one partner is an amateur member of an AGA member club or if one partner is a golf professional employed by an AGA member club. Pro-Pro sides are not eligible.

title: European Men's Club Trophy
notes:
Three-player teams represent clubs from across Europe 
in this 54-hole tournament. 
Team (best two scores out of the three players each 
day) and individual competitions.

title: Southern California Women's Cup Matches - CANCELLED
notes:
**Cancelled for 2020.

The Southern California Women's Cup Matches are an annual team event between the top players from the SCGA and SCPGA. The inaugural match was played in 2011. These matches see the top eight women amateurs from the Women's Southern California Golf Council and the Southern California PGA's top eight women from the Women's Player of the Year standings play over the two days. The 36- hole match includes 18-hole team and singles matches to determine the winners.

title: Haymaker Fall Classic
notes:
36-hole stroke play tournament with Open and Senior 
divisions. Colorado Cup points event.

title: Twin Peaks Fall Invitational - CANCELLED
notes:
**Cancelled due to the coronavirus outbreak.

36-hole stroke play tournament. CGA Player of the Year Points will be awarded to the Championship and Senior Championship flights. The senior flight, age 50+, will be gross scoring only.

title: Green Valley Ranch Amateur - CANCELLED
notes:
**Cancelled for 2020.

36-hole stroke play tournament hosted at Green Valley Ranch Golf Club. Colorado Cup points event.

title: Pacific Women's Team Play Championship
notes:
36 hole club team championship, with a best two balls 
of four format. Must be a PWGA
