member in good standing prior to entry open 
date.

title: Maryland Women's Mid-Amateur Championship
notes:
This tournament is open to female amateur golfers who 
are members of member clubs of the MSGA with a 
USGA INDEX of 30.0 or less, and who have reached 
their 30th birthday by the start of the tournament.
The tournament will be an 18-hole stroke play 
competition.

title: Maryland Women's Open Championship
notes:
36-hole stroke play tournament open to female 
amateur golfers who are members of member clubs of 
the MSGA (Maryland State Golf Association) or the 
VSGA (Virginia State Golf Association) with a USGA 
INDEX of 14.0 or less and to female professional 
golfers. Amateur golfers must have a handicap index 
with the MSGA or VSGA.

title: Maryland Senior Women's Championship
notes:
36-hole stroke play tournament open to female 
amateur golfers who are members of member clubs of 
the MSGA with an up-to-date USGA INDEX of 36.0 or 
less and who have reached their 50th birthday by 
midnight of the first day of play.

title: Northern California Net Amateur Championship
notes:
First played in 1994, the NCGA Net Amateur Championship is an individual handicap event for NCGA members of regular clubs. It is contested in three flights divided by handicap index. The championship rotates every year between Poppy Hills GC and Poppy Ridge GC.

Players must have a numeric handicap index listed on their club's Master Report, not exceeding 36.4 (men) or 40.4 (women) on the date of registration. No players under 18 years of age.

FORMAT: Qualifying – 18 holes. Championship proper – 36 holes, 18 holes per day. Players will use 100% of their course handicap at all levels of play.

title: Indiana Junior/Senior Championship
notes:
18-hole four-ball stroke play championship. Each 2 man 
team must consist of an Amateur under the age of 55 
and an Amateur the age of 55 or older. Entrants 
must currently be affiliated with an 
IGA-PGA member club and possess a current 
IGA-PGA 
GHIN approved handicap index.

title: Harry Oppenheimer Trophy
notes:
72-hole stroke play championship open to amateurs 
who are members of a Golf Club affiliated to the South 
African Golf Association and
who have a handicap of 3 (THREE) or less assessed in 
terms of the SAGA Course Rating and Handicapping 
System.

title: Bobby Locke Invitational - CANCELLED
notes:
**Cancelled due to the coronavirus outbreak.

54 hole stroke play championship with a cut after 36 holes. Open to Amateurs who are members of a Golf Club affiliated to a Union recognised by the South African Golf Association and GolfRSA and who have a handicap index of 4 (four) or less as assessed in terms of the SAGA Course Rating and Handicapping System or any other system acceptable to the SAGA.

title: Silver Salver Amateur Championship
notes:
54 hole stroke play championship with a cut 
after 36 holes. Open to any male Amateur who is a full 
member of a Golf Club
affiliated to a Union recognised by the S.A.G.A. and 
who at the time of submitting this entry
shall have a handicap index of 4 or less.

title: South Australia Amateur Championship
notes:
The South Australia (WA) Amateur is open to men and 
women of any age, and contested over 36-holes stroke 
play qualifying with the leading 32 men and 16 or 8 
women (subject to numbers) progressing to elimination 
match play.

title: Dayton Valley Senior Amateur
notes:
Scratch and Net Divisions. Must be 50 years 
or older by day of event; 60 and over for 
Silver Division. Player must appear on the 
current active list of members for NNGA 
(Northern Nevada Golf Association) prior to 
tournament deadline.

title: Oklahoma Women's Cup
notes:
Club Teams will consist of 4 women. A woman is eligible to play on 1) the Club Team of her Home Club or 2) the Club Team of a club of which she is a dues-paying member of that club's Women's Golf Association.

Four 9-hole Four-Ball (better ball) matches and four 9-hole Foursomes (alternate shot) matches. Each team pairing will play in two four-ball matches and two foursomes matches. All team members play in every competition, except tiebreaker. The teams who play the front nine in the first round of the day will play the back nine in the second round of the day and visa versa. Each hole in a match is worth one point (win=1 point, tie =1/2 point). Four-Ball total points=36; Foursomes total points = 36; Total points available = 72.

title: Copa Baleares
notes:
72-hole stroke play event with a cut 
after 54 holes. The 
field is largely Spanish but does draw players from 
around Europe

title: Southern California Women's Amateur Net Championship
notes:
The premier SCGA women's net championship is 
contested over two days and 36 holes. This 
championship is open to female SCGA members of all 
skill levels who will play using Course Handicaps. This 
championship was formerly known the SCGA Senior 
Women's Net Championship.

title: Chicago District Mixed Championship
notes:
This is an 18-hole stroke play team event. Teams will 
play within flighted Gross and Net divisions. Scoring 
will be a combined stableford using current handicap 
indexes. Players are awarded points based upon their 
score in relation to par on each hole. The winner of 
either the Gross or Net division will be the team who 
scores the highest number of points. Any male and 
female who are active members of a CDGA member 
club and have a current CDGA handicap index may 
enter as a team.

title: British Womens Senior Amateur Championship - CANCELLED
notes:
**Cancelled due to the coronavirus outbreak.

The R&A Womens Senior Amateur Championship was first played in 1981. The championship is open to players aged 50 years and over and is held annually. The competitor with the lowest 54-hole total over four rounds of stroke play will be declared the winner. After 36 holes, the players returning the 40 lowest scores and any tying for 40th place qualify for the final 18 holes.

title: New Hampshire Spring Four-Ball - CANCELLED
notes:
**Cancelled due to the coronavirus outbreak.

Tournament is 18 holes stroke play, 2-man best-ball. Prizes will be awarded to the top finishers in the gross and net divisions. Open to male golfers with an active New Hampshire GHIN Handicap.

title: Veterans Golf Classic
notes:
54 hole, two-person tournament for military veterans 
(Army, Navy, Marines, Air Force or Coast Guard) 
played over three 
courses with a different format each day. Round 1 is 
a 
two-person best-ball (80% handicap), Round 2 is a 
modified alternate shot (40% handicap), and 
Round 3 is a Texas Scramble (25% team handicap). 
All 
participants will play to the lowest handicap index 
revision of the last 12 months.

title: Southern Nevada Winter Classic
notes:
36-hole stroke play championship with 
Championship, 
Net, Senior (ages 50+, gross and net), and Silver (ages 
60+, gross and net) divisions. 
Must be an SNGA member.

title: Georgia Tournament of Champions
notes:
Open to the current year Men's, Women's and Senior 
Men's Club Champions of GSGA Member Clubs. 36 
holes of individual, flighted stroke play.

title: Delaware Senior 27-Hole Challenge
notes:
27-hole flighted stroke play tournament open to 
male senior amateur golfers. Format: Nine (9) hole 
scramble, nine (9) hole alternate shot, nine (9) hole 
four-ball.

title: Delaware Team Challenge
notes:
Tournament Format - Best 2 of 4 (Gross & Net Prizes). 
Team Composition: All four players on a team must 
have an active handicap at any DSGA member club. 
Teams can include players (men or women) from any 
member club.

title: Newnan Senior Classic
notes:
36-hole stroke play tournament open to all 
Professionals and Amateurs who live 
in the state of Georgia and are age 50 or older. 
Senior 
and Super Senior divisions.

title: Tony Lema Amateur Championship
notes:
36-hole individual stroke play championship for 
amateurs and seniors.

title: Kings County Classic
notes:
36-hole stroke play championship with a Championship 
Flight (no age limit) and Handicap Flights, with the 
arrangement of flights based on the number of entries.

title: Fall Oak Hollow Open
notes:
This will be a 36 Hole, two person team event 
playing 
Captain’s Choice Style (Catfight). The field will be 
flighted after the first round. Entries are open to all 
amateur golfers 16 years of age or older. Entries are 
subject to approval or rejection by the Tournament 
Committee. Open to the First 100 Teams. Seniors 
play 
from shorter tees.

title: Carolinas Super Senior Four-Ball Tournament of Champions
notes:
Tournament format is 36 holes of flighted four-ball 
stroke play, gross and net
scores, with divisions for players ages 65+ and 70+. 
According to USGA handicap procedures, 90 
percent of a player's course handicap is used to
determine net scores. Must be a CGA 
member.
courseName: Barefoot Resort and Golf Club - Love Course

title: Taconic Men's Four-Ball Tournament
notes:
Two-person best-ball gross tournament held at a classic 
Donald Ross course. Two 
divisions: Junior (ages 49 and under) and Senior (ages 
50 and over).

title: Balmoral Woods Fall Senior Championship
notes:
36-hole individual stroke play tournament for seniors, 
with an additional division for seniors aged 60 and over.

title: Northern Nevada Women's Amateur
notes:
36-hole stroke play tournament open to female golfers 
of at least 15 years of age with a GHIN number on file. 
Must be a member of the Northern Nevada Golf 
Association. Open, senior (ages 50-59, 60-69) and 
silver (ages 70+) flights.

title: Harrisburg District Senior Championship
notes:
18 holes: Open to all senior amateur golfers residing or 
maintaining a 
handicap with HDGA member clubs or affiliate 
member clubs.

title: Maine Club Team Championship
notes:
The Club Team Championship features four-man 
teams 
consisting of players all from the same golf club. As 
is 
such, all players must be in good standing of the 
same 
MSGA member club on or before the date they 
submit 
their application. The championship will consist of 18 
holes of stroke play. Players will play their own ball, 
with the two low gross and net scores counting for 
each 
hole.

title: Maine Senior Club Team Championship
notes:
**Cancelled due to the coronavirus outbreak.

The Senior Club Team Championship features four- man teams consisting of players all from the same golf club. As is such, all players must be 55 years of age or older in good standing of the same MSGA member club on or before the date they submit their application. The championship will consist of 18 holes of stroke play. Players will play their own ball, with the two low gross and net scores counting for each hole.

title: Ontario Public Amateur Championship
notes:
36 Holes Stroke Play. Three Flights: A Flight - % of 
players with the lowest Handicap Factors - Gross 
Competition, B Flight - % of players with the next 
lowest Handicap Factors - Net Competition, C Flight - % 
of players with the highest Handicap Factors - Net 
Competition.

title: Puget Sound Amateur
notes:
36-hole stroke play tournament played on Lake 
Spanaway and Chambers Bay, with gross and net 
scoring. The round at Chambers Bay is walking-only. 
Field limited to the first 132 paid entries.

title: Amateur Golf Alliance Women’s Amateur Championship
notes:
The tournament will be 54 holes of stroke play for 
eligible women who have completed their college 
eligibility and are 23 years of age on or before the 
first 
round of the competition. Field limited to 78 players. 
Applicants must have a USGA handicap index of 6.0 
or 
lower. Entries will be reviewed based on playing 
experience, competitive success, rankings and merit 
against those of other applicants.

title: Oregon Tour Championship
notes:
36-hole stroke play competition with open and senior 
divisions. Invitations will be extended to the top 10 
players on the season-long Oregon Golf Association 
Individual Series points list.

title: Washington Mixed Chapman Championship
notes:
Format: 18-hole Chapman Stroke Play (Gross and 
Net). The field will be divided into flights based on team 
course handicap. Handicap Limit: 36.4 for males; 40.4 
for females.

title: Peninsula Amateur Golf Tournament
notes:
36-hole individual stroke play tournament. 
Championship flight (max handicap 7.4) plus 
flights for 
seniors and super seniors (max handicap 9.4).

title: South Carolina Women's Team Championship
notes:
36-hole team event for South Carolina women 
amateurs, with a different format each day. First day 
is a two-person best-ball and the second day is a 
modified alternate shot. Open to any female amateur 
golfer who is a legal resident of South Carolina for a 
minimum of six months prior to the championship, is 
a member of a WSCGA club, and has a current GHIN 
handicap index issued by the Handicap Program of 
the Carolinas.

title: South Carolina Senior Women's Championship
notes:
36-hole stroke play championship open to female 
senior amateur (ages 50+) golfers. Open to any 
female 
amateur golfer who is a legal resident of South 
Carolina 
for a minimum of six months prior to the 
championship, 
is a member of a WSCGA club, and has a current 
GHIN 
handicap index issued by the Handicap Program of 
the 
Carolinas.

title: Senior Golfers of America Lobster Festival - POSTPONED
notes:
**Postponed due to the coronavirus outbreak.

54-hole individual stroke play tournament for members of Senior Golfers of America. Open to men and women seniors (ages 50 and over) and super seniors (60+ for women, 65+ for men). The field will be divided into flight of 16 players each for as many flights as number of contestants permit. Flight winners will be determined at net scores with handicap deducted.

title: Blaine T. Ingram Four-Ball Championship
notes:
36-hole four-ball tournament with Stableford scoring. 
Regular and senior (ages 55+) divisions. Limited to 72 
teams/144 players.

title: Annandale Four-Ball Championship
notes:
54-hole four-ball stroke play tournament held at 
Annandale Golf Club. Regular and senior divisions.

title: Gig Harbor City Amateur
notes:
36-hole stroke play tournament with overall Gross and 
Net champions. Flighted after the first round.

title: Capital City Invitational
notes:
36-hole individual stroke play tournament that has 
been contested 
since the 1940s. Past winners of this event include 
Hudson Swafford, 
Kenny Knox, Marcus Beck, and Jeff Sluman. Two 
divisions: Men's and 
Senior. Players will be flighted based on their 
handicaps and the 
number of participants only. The competition is gross 
only for the 
Men’s Division, but the Senior Division will be Gross 
& Net.

title: USGC King's Cup National Championship - CANCELLED
notes:
**Cancelled due to the coronavirus outbreak.

This is the U.S. final qualifier for the International King's Cup which is held the following spring. Two-man teams will compete in three different formats, and the successful qualifiers will represent Team USA in the King's Cup. Round 1 is a best-ball, round 2 is alternate shot, and round 3 is aggregate stroke play.

There are two divisions – Open Division and Senior Division. Open Division is open to all ages. Senior Division is for Players 55 years of age and above. A Player that is 55+ is allowed to compete in the Open division, but a player that is under 55 is not allowed to compete in the Senior division. There are four flights in each Division determined by Team Index.
courseName: The Legends Golf Complex - Heathland Course

title: George Sands Memorial Four-Ball Championship
notes:
This is an 18-hole, Four-Ball Stroke Play Competition. 
Prizes will be awarded to both the Championship and
Senior (55+) divisions.

title: Updegraff Cup
notes:
Team matches between North and South Arizona senior 
players (16 players from 50 to 74 and 4 players from 
75 plus age divisions). Day 1 is Two person Four-Ball in 
the morning and Two person Modified Chapman (both 
players drive, hit each other's drives and select shot to 
alternate in) in the afternoon. Day 2 is Singles.

title: Wiggy Cup Invitational
notes:
36-hole best-ball tournament named after Dick "Wiggy" 
Weigold, who started as a caddy at Torrington Country 
Club and later won the state amateur while a club 
member.

title: North Bellingham Amateur
notes:
36-hole individual stroke play tournament with Gross 
and Net payouts in each of 
two flights. Those without a handicap may play to a
0 handicap or the same handicap as the best player in 
the field, whichever is lower.

title: Saratoga County Amateur Golf Championship
notes:
36-hole individual stroke play tournament played on 
two courses. There will be an Open division and a 
Senior division for players 50 years of age and older. 
Open to residents of Saratoga County, New York.

title: Ontario Open Championship - CANCELLED
notes:
**Cancelled due to the coronavirus outbreak.

72-hole stroke play championship open to professionals and amateurs with a 5.4 handicap index or lower who are good standing members of Golf Canada/Golf Ontario or their respective Provincial, Regional or State Golf Association. Pre-qualifying required for those not exempt.

title: Labor Day Classic
notes:
36-hole individual stroke play tournament recognized 
as the oldest amateur golf tournament in the state. 
This event offers a par-3 tournament, shootouts, 
putting contests and 36 holes of flighted stroke play. 
Nebraska Golf Association points event.

title: Michelob Ultra Amateur Championship
notes:
36-hole individual stroke play tournament with open 
and senior divisions. Preceded by a long-drive contest 
in two age divisions — 54-under and 55-up.

title: NEXUS Cup - CANCELLED
notes:
**Cancelled due to the coronavirus outbreak.

First played in 2019, this tournament promises to be the most exclusive amateur event in the world. Teams compete in matches across two days at Liberty National and vie for a spot in the championship shootout. Tiger Woods is the tournamnet host, and all proceeds benefit the TGR Foundation and its mission to empower students to pursue their passions through education. From staff bags and personalized team apparel, to luxurious prizes and social events, this is a next-level invitation-only event.

title: Amsterdam City Championship
notes:
36-hole stroke play championship with Men's, 
Women's, Junior and Senior divisions. Gross and net 
competitions.

title: Southeast Mid-Amateur Four-Ball Championship
notes:

male amateur golfers who have an active USGA 
Handicap index. Maximum allowable combined team 
handicap is 8.8 for the Mid-Amateur Division (ages 25 
and over); 12.8 for Senior Division (ages 50 and over).  
Partners are not required to be from the same club or 
state.

title: Legends & Leaders Pro-Am
notes:
Pro-Am preceding the PURE Insurance Championship. Each group will be made up of three amateurs and one PGA TOUR Champions professional in a one net and one gross best ball competition. Proceeds benefit Monterey Peninsula Foundation and The First Tee of Monterey County.

Each pro-am participant is invited to bring a guest to the Legends & Leaders Evening which includes strolling coastal cuisine and boutique Napa Valley wine tasting culminating with a speaker program. The program will feature notables from the business and entertainment world highlighting The First Tee Core Values.

Past notable speakers include: Arnold Palmer, Tom Watson III, Bill Murray, Leon Panetta, Lindsey Vonn, Herm Edwards, Johnny Miller, Joe Louis Barrow Jr., Capt. Sully Sullenberger, Heidi Ueberroth, Peter Ueberroth, and Alfonso Ribeiro.

title: Twin Lakes Amateur
notes:
36-hole stroke play championship with three flights. 
Must have a verifiable USGA handicap (max of 29).

title: Mercer County Amateur
notes:
54-hole stroke play tournament, with the first round 
played on a Thursday and the final two rounds played 
on the weekend. Open to any golfer with with a GHIN 
handicap of 10 or lower.
courseName: Mercer Oaks Golf Course - West Course

title: Seniors of the Tri-State Golf Tournament
notes:
36-hole stroke play tournament for male amateur 
golfers 50 years of age 
and older.  It usually has both an amateur division 
and a professional 
division and is limited to the first 130 paid 
participants. Players compete 
within their own age groups (i.e., 50-54, 55-59, 60-
64, 65-69, 70-74, 
75-79, 80 and over). The event traditionally draws 
players from across 
the Midwest and Southeast.

title: Ojai Senior Cup
notes:
Inaugural event in 2019 that aims to become one of the top Senior Amateur Championships on the West Coast. Played at two classic golf courses located in the beautiful destination location of Ojai, California.

36-hole stroke play tournament for seniors aged 50 and over, with Gross and Net championships. The maximum handicap for the Gross division is 3.9. For the Net division, flights for men and women will be established based on required GHIN index.

title: Klipper Amateur
notes:
54-stroke play tournament open to all amateur golfers 
with a GHIN handicap. Field will be cut approximately in 
half after 36 holes. Flights: Championship (4.9 
handicap and under), A Flight (5.0-9.9), B Flight (10.0 
handicap or higher), Senior (ages 55 and older).

title: Senior Golfers of America Pebble Beach
notes:
54-hole individual stroke play tournament for 
members 
of Senior Golfers of America. Open to men and 
women 
seniors (ages 50 and over) and super seniors (60+ 
for 
women, 65+ for men). The field will be divided into 
flight of 16 players each for as many flights as 
number 
of contestants permit. Flight winners will be 
determined 
at net scores with handicap deducted.

title: Arizona Southern District Fall Partners Tournament
notes:
STABLEFORD SCORING – Day 1 (Catalina Course) & 
Day 2 (Sonoran
Course): Better Ball of Partners (Gross & Net) 95% 
of handicap
allowance for net. Maximum handicap of 36. No 
more
than eight (8) strokes between partners. Participants 
must be a paid-up member of the AWGA and SDWGA 
by the
opening date of the tournament.

title: University of Maryland Amateur
notes:
36 holes of stroke play with Championship, 1st, 2nd, 
3rd, and Senior (ages 55+) Flights. Open to any male 
amateur golfer holding a current USGA Handicap. 
Reduced entry fees for UMD students.

title: Schuylkill County Club Invitational
notes:
36-hole two-man better ball of partners tournament 
hosted by Schuylkill Country Club, limited to 40 teams. 
Entry fee includes green fees, carts, range balls, lunch, 
and prizes.

title: Springhaven Cup Invitational
notes:
36-hole two-man best ball tournament hosted by The 
Springhaven Club for nearly 100 years. Amateur and 
Legacy (senior) divisions.

title: Wine Valley Amateur
notes:
Started in 2019, this is a 36-hole stroke play 
tournament with Open, Senior (ages 50+) and Ladies 
divisions, with Gross and Net competitions. $10,000 
Payout with full field of 112 players.

title: Lighthouse Invitational
notes:
54-hole tournament for men and women played at the 
three Sea Pines Resort courses: Heron Point, Atlantic 
Dunes and Harbour Town Golf Links. Tournament 
participants are required to stay in the resort.

title: Copa Nacional Puerta de Hierro
notes:
Stroke play qualifying to determine 64 players for 
match play.

title: Sacramento City 2020 Junior/Senior Championship
notes:
The 72nd annual Walter & Olga Strand Junior/Senior Chapman Scotch City Championship will be contested at Bartley Cavanaugh Golf Course on Saturday, September 26, 2020.

This tournament is open to all golfers with or without an established World Handicap System (WHS) Index. Juniors must be 18 years of age or younger, and the senior partner must be at least 15 years older than their junior partner. Each team must secure their own partner.

This is an 18-hole, 2-player team event. The competition will use a Chapman Scotch format (Hit, Switch and Choose). Complete rules will be explained on the day of play. There will be two divisions - a Handicap Division and a Callaway Division.

The Handicap Division will be for teams where both players have a current WHS Index. The difference between the team member’s Indexes may not be more than 20. For players with a WHS Index, the September 15, 2020 index will be used. The Callaway Division will be for teams with no WHS Index or where only one team partner has an index.

Ties for the Championship will be broken by matching scorecards.

The entry fee is $99 per 2-person team, and includes green fee, tee prizes, power cart, lunch and awards. The field is limited to the first 50 team paid entries.

The registration deadline is September 20, 2020. Please note that the senior (adult) partner must complete registration for the team.

title: Sacramento County 2020 Regional Four-Ball Championship
notes:
The 2020 Sacramento County Men’s Four-Ball Championship will be contested at Mather Golf Course on October 17-18 and October 24-25, 2020. The tournament is open to all amateur golfers with a current World Handicap System (WHS) Index of 7.0 or less as of October 15, 2020.

The tournament format is as follows:

All play conducted under USGA rules. Play is at scratch. All rounds will be posted by the Tournament Director.

- 4-Ball stroke play qualifying round on Saturday, October 17 – 7:58 a.m. morning tee times*
- 1st Round matches 18 holes Sunday, October 18 – 7:58 a.m. morning tee times
- 2nd Round matches 18 holes Saturday, October 24 – 7:34 a.m. morning tee times
- 3rd Round matches 18 holes Saturday, October 24 – 1:02 p.m. afternoon tee times
- 4th Round matches 18 holes Sunday, October 25 – 7:34 a.m. morning tee times
- Championship match Sunday, October 25 – 1:02 p.m. afternoon tee time – if needed.

* Low 31 or 15 teams plus defending champions or low 32 or 16 teams will advance to the match play round on Sunday, October 18. (Defending Champions playing as a team shall receive automatic qualification into match play unless they elect to compete in the qualifying round). Ties will be broken by sudden death playoff from first hole unless there would be an option to play from another hole if both teams agree.

The entry fee is $260 per team and includes ALL qualifying and match play green fees (power carts not included). Golf carts may be rented in the golf shop prior to play. The field is limited to paid entries from the first 72 teams.

The entry deadline is October 12, 2020 and there will be no refunds after this date. Late entries will be accepted if space is available with cash only - no exceptions.

title: Spanish Women's International Stroke Play
notes:
72 hole stroke play championship with a cut after 36 
holes. Draws a strong field from across Europe.

title: Santa Ynez Golf Championship
notes:
36-hole individual stroke play tournament, gross and 
net flights. Net flights for handicaps 11-18 and 19-39. 
Grand prize in each flight is a three day, two night golf 
vacation package at Alisal Guest Ranch and Resort 
along with pro shop credit.

title: Nevada Senior Women's Amateur
notes:
36-hole stroke play tournament with a 
maximum handicap allowance of 36. Divisions: 50-59, 
60-69, 70+. Gross and net prizes.

title: Silver Cup Matches
notes:
The Silver Cup is modeled after the Curtis Cup Matches 
and features competition between the Northern and 
Southern women's golf associations in Nevada. Teams 
of 20 compete in brackets of 10 ordered by handicap 
index.

title: Women's Southern Nevada Amateur
notes:
36-hole stroke play tournament for WSNGA members. 
Must have a verifiable 
Southern NV issued handicap number with a handicap 
not exceeding 36.
courseName: Las Vegas Paiute Resort - Sun Mountain Course

title: Port Phillip Open Amateur
notes:
72-hole stroke play tournament held on two courses, 
with a cut after 36 holes. The low 32 players qualify for 
the Victorian Amateur match play tournament held 
immediately after.

title: California State Fair 2020 Senior & Super Senior Championship
notes:
The 24th annual California State Fair Senior Championship and 11th annual California State Fair Super Senior Championship will be contested on Saturday and Sunday, September 5 and 6, 2020 at Mather Golf Course.

The tournament is played at scratch and is open to male amateur golfers 55 and older with a current handicap index of 7.4 or less (Senior) and 65 and older with an index of 9.4 and less (Super Senior). The Super Senior flight will also include a Legends division (age 75 and older).

The entry fee is $175 and includes two days of green fees, range balls and awards (power carts not included).

The competition will be stroke play over 36 holes (18 holes each day). In an effort to improve pace of play, tee time intervals will be set at 10 minutes rather than the usual 8 minute intervals. In the event of a tie for the championship title (Senior and Super Senior), there will be a playoff.

The entry deadline is August 28, 2020.

title: Port Phillip Women's Open Amateur
notes:
72-hole stroke play tournament held on two courses, 
with a cut after 36 holes. The low 16 players qualify for 
the Victorian Women's Amateur match play tournament 
held immediately after.

title: Victorian Women's Amateur Championship
notes:
The low 16 women finishers in the Port Phillip Women's 
Amateur qualify for elimination match play in the 
Victorian Women's Amateur.

title: Mississippi Women's State Four-Ball Championship
notes:
The tournament is scheduled for 36 holes of four-ball 
stroke play. All 
participants are required to have an active GHIN 
Handicap through a USGA Licensed Mississippi Club. 
Participants must be bona fide residents of the state 
of Mississippi for at least 60 days prior to the first 
round of the tournament.

title: Southwest Team Challenge
notes:
These matches, hosted by the Arizona Golf Association, 
attract teams from golf associations all over the west 
coast. Teams are comprised of four players each, all of 
whom must be over 25 years of age, and at least two 
of whom must be over 50 years of age. The format is a 
four-ball stroke play at gross using a modified 
stableford scoring system.

title: California State Fair 2020 Women's Championship
notes:
The 25th State Fair Women's Championship will be contested at Bartley Cavanaugh Golf Course, Sacramento, CA on September 5 and 6, 2020.

The tournament is open to all women amateur golfers age 18 or older by September 5, 2020, with an established World Handicap System (WHS) Index of 36.4 or less, members of a college golf team, junior girls ages 14-18 who placed in the top three in the 2020 SGC City or County Women’s Tournaments scratch flight, or the top three junior girls in the 15- 18 Division of the 2019 State Fair Junior Championship or the top three junior girls in any of the 2020 SGC Junior Championships Age 14-18 Division, or special invitation.

August 26, 2020 is the deadline – no refunds after this date. Please call Barbara Conerly, Tournament Director (916-428-1377) regarding cancellations or refund requests prior to the deadline. There will be a $25 service charge on all returned checks or a $10 administrative fee for any withdrawals for online registration.

Handicaps will be based on August 15, 2020 indexes.

The Championship Flight contestants must have an index of 6.6 or less and will play at scratch from the back (Blue) tees. Senior Net Handicap Flight(s), age 60+, determined by handicap or age (entries permitting) and Net Handicap Flight(s) will play using handicaps from the forward (Black tees). Ties for overall low gross, overall low net and overall senior low net will be decided in a hole-by-hole sudden death playoff. All other ties will be decided based on the USGA recommended method of matching score cards.

Entry fees are $130 per person for non-City “Play Card” holders; $125 for City Adult “Play Card” holders; $120 for Seniors with a City Senior “Play Card”. The entry fee includes two (2) days green fees and awards (Power Cart Not Included).

title: California State Fair 2020 Men's Championship
notes:
The State Fair Men's Amateur Championship is one 
of 
the oldest and most prestigious Amateur 
Championships in the West. The Championship is 
limited to 156 players. Competition commences over 
a 
54-hole stroke play format with 18 holes played 
each 
day. The field is cut after 36 holes to the low 45 
players 
& ties.

title: Florida Two-Man Scramble Championship
notes:
Introduced in 2020, this is a 36-hole two-man 
scramble stroke play 
championship for current Adult Members of the FSGA 
who are ages 
21 and over, with handicaps of 7.0 or lower. 
Championship and 
Senior (both players ages 55+) divisions. This 
Championship will be 
setup to test the finest players in the state, similar to 
what is seen 
at the Four-Ball Championship and State Amateur.
courseName: The Country Club of Winter Haven

title: Tri-State Tournament
notes:
Team matches between Maine, Vermont, and New 
Hampshire. Three 
way match with partners from each state earning 
one point for a 
victory against each of the other two opponents. 
Each team is made 
up of 14 male players, 10 form the regular division 
and 4 make up 
the senior team.

title: California State Fair 2020 Mid-Amateur Championship
notes:
The California State Fair Men’s Mid-Amateur Championship (formerly State Fair Masters Championship) will be contested at Bing Maloney Golf Course on August 22-23, 2020.

The tournament is open to all male amateur golfers age 30 or older (no maximum age), who are members of an organized golf club with a World Handicap System (WHS) Index of 7.0 or less. The August 15th WHS will be used to determine eligibility unless confirmation of equivalent ability is received.

The entry fee of $129 ($99 for past State Fair Masters champions) per player includes greens fees and all awards - power carts not included.

The tournament format is 18 holes of stroke play on Saturday, August 22 and 18 holes on Sunday, August 23. The contestant with the lowest score for the 36-holes will be declared the 2020 California State Fair Mid-Amateur Champion. In the event of a tie for the championship, a sudden death playoff will start immediately following play beginning on the 17th tee.

The entry deadline is Sunday, August 16, 2020. There will be a $10 cancellation fee for all withdrawals prior to the entry deadline and a $25 administrative fee for all returned checks.

title: North Carolina Senior Open Championship
notes:
36 hole stroke play championship for senior 
professionals 
and 
amateurs ages 50 and over. Amateurs must reside in 
North or South 
Carolina and have a current USGA Handicap Index of 
10.0 or less. There will be a Senior Division (age 
50+) 
and a Super Senior Division (age 65+).

title: Southern Illinois Amateur
notes:
36 hole stroke play tournament with open and 
senior 
divisions. Entries are 
open 
to amateur golfers who are affiliated with or 
are a 
member of a club which is a Member Club of 
the 
Metropolitan Amateur Golf Association.

title: Northern Nevada Tournament of Champions
notes:
18-hole stroke play invitational, for men and women, 
based on performance throughout the NNGA season.

title: Maine Senior Match Play Invitational
notes:
The Senior Match Play Championship is an 
invitational-only 
event. The field is determined by the top 16 
finishers 
(and ties)
from the year's Maine Senior Championship. The 
remainder of the field will be determined by the top 
point earners
from the Player of the Year race, which concludes at 
the end of July. All entrants must be members of 
good standing
at an MSGA club, have a current MSGA membership, 
and a valid USGA Handicap. Format is a round of 32 
match play bracket.

title: Battlement Mesa Two-Man
notes:
36-hole two-man four-ball stroke play tournament with 
Championship and Senior flights.

title: Stocker Cup 2020 Invitational - CANCELLED
notes:
**Cancelled due to the coronavirus outbreak.

The Stocker Cup was founded in 1991 to honor the memory of Peter Stocker. Peter and his partners Bill Harlan and John Montgomery founded San Francisco's Pacific Union Company, a highly successful real estate development company. The firm initiated the development of The Santa Lucia Preserve, a 20,000 acre residential and golf community located above Carmel. Meandering through the winding road to The Preserve's centerpiece -- the top-100 rated golf course -- has been described as "driving through a California postcard." The Stocker Cup was played from 1991 to 1999 at Pebble Beach and its surrounding golf courses, before moving to the Tom Fazio and Sandy Tatum designed Preserve G.C. In the words of former USGA President Tatum: "Peter Stocker was the quintessential amateur golfer. He loved golf with a passion. He would have loved this tournament."

FORMAT:
54-hole individual competition with a simultaneous best-ball event, similar to the AT&T Pebble Beach Pro-Am. Invited Mid- Amateur players are either paired with a single digit amateur or can propose their own partner to be introduced and invited by the Committee.

title: Stone Cup
notes:
Format: 18-holes; four-ball stroke play

Eligibility: Mixed pairs (male & female); 24.0 Handicap Index or less (per player). Partners do not have to be from the same club/course.

notes:
Senior version of the Golden Isles Invitational that dates back to 
1949. 54-hole stroke play championship.

title: Memphis Senior Amateur Championship

36-hole stroke play championship played over two

title: James H. Fyke Municipal Senior Amateur Championship
notes:
The Municipal Amateur Championship was founded in 1981 by Jim Fyke. Modeled after the City Open, it was his vision to create an amateur golf championship that was truly open to all competitors in Nashville and the surrounding areas. 36 hole stroke play championship.

Applications are open to male senior residents of the Nashville Metropolitan Statistical Area who meet the USGA definition of an amateur golfer. Persons applying for reinstatement to amateur status are not eligible.

The Metropolitan Statistical Area includes:Nashville- Davidson-Murfreesboro-Franklin (Cannon, Cheatham, Davidson, Dickson, Hickman, Macon, Maury, Robertson, Rutherford, Smith, Sumner, Trousdale, Williamson, Wilson)

title: James H. Fyke Municipal Women's Amateur Championship
notes:
The Municipal Amateur Championship was founded in 1981 by Jim Fyke. Modeled after the City Open, it was his vision to create an amateur golf championship that was truly open to all competitors in Nashville and the surrounding areas. 36 hole stroke play championship.

Applications are open to female residents of the Nashville Metropolitan Statistical Area who meet the USGA definition of an amateur golfer. Persons applying for reinstatement to amateur status are not eligible. All competitors must be at least 12 years of age.

The Metropolitan Statistical Area includes:Nashville- Davidson-Murfreesboro-Franklin (Cannon, Cheatham, Davidson, Dickson, Hickman, Macon, Maury, Robertson, Rutherford, Smith, Sumner, Trousdale, Williamson, Wilson)

title: Naperville Senior Amateur Championship
notes:
The Naperville Senior Amateur Championship is an 
enjoyable 36-hole format, with 18-holes played at each 
course. Flights are determined by age (Seniors 55-69, 
Legends 70+). Each flight will declare a low gross and 
low net Champion. The overall low gross score will be 
declared the Naperville Senior Amateur Champion. Any 
amateur golfer 55 years of age or older with an official 
USGA handicap is eligible.

title: Metropolitan Golf Association Four-Ball Championship

Member Clubs. Partners need not be members of the same club but both must 
be members of an MGA Member Club.

same club but both must

title: John R. Williams 2020 Four-Ball Invitational - CANCELLED

54-hole two man best ball format. By invitation only. Entrants must have a handicap of 3.4 or less, with the team total not to exceed 5.5. Both members of teams in the Senior Division must be 55 years of age by the first day of the tournament. Senior index requirements are 4.4 individual and 7.2 team.

notes:
First played in 2020, this is a 54-hole individual stroke play open to any golfer who is at least 65 years of age (as of event start date) and whose index does not exceed 9.4. title: East West Matches
notes:
New in 2020, the East West Matches feature Ryder Cup-style team matches for American mid-amateurs and seniors. The Mississippi River is the dividing line between East and West teams, each of which is comprised of 18 players: 6 seniors, at least 10 mid-amateurs, and up to 2 amateurs who haven't yet reached the age of 25.

A points system will be utilized to select 50% of each team, with the other 50% chosen by the tournament committee. Teams will be selected at the conclusion of the US Mid and US Senior Amateur Championships.

The schedule of play is 18 holes of four-ball on Friday, 36 holes of foursomes on Saturday, and 18 holes of singles on Sunday.

title: Dixie Senior & Mid-Master 2020 Invitational
notes: The senior version of the Dixie Amateur Championship has added a Mid-Master division starting in 2019. 54-hole stroke play event with no cut. Mid-Master (ages 40- 54), Senior (ages 55-64) and Super Senior (65+) Divisions. The final round will be a Shotgun start. The tournament has long drawn some of the country's top senior golfers to South Florida -- Doug Hanzel (2013-2014, 2017); Brady Exber (2012); and Rick Woulfe (an amazing 7 titles, his latest in 2015) are among the past champions. All three rounds are contested at the TPC Eagle Trace. You may request an invitation at www.dixieamateur.com.

title: Dixie Women's Amateur 2020 Invitational

Field consists of former Dixie Amateur Champions, and women from around the world invited by the Tournament Committee. (You may request an invitation at www.dixieamateur.com). Tournament takes on extra importance as the last major international amateur event to be played before the Augusta National Women's Amateur (ANWA) determines their ranking-based exemption list. 120 player limit. Field is cut after 54 holes to the low 70 players and ties.

Historic Florida amateur golf tournament that is open to former Dixie Amateur champions, tournament committee invitees and qualifiers for major amateur championships. The Dixie has a traditionally strong field due to college break, and a past-champions list that includes many PGA Tour players as well as top-ranked amateurs.

72-hole stroke play championship with a 54 hole cut down to 72 players and ties. Field limited to 120 players. Played at Eagle Trace Golf Club. New entry options include a meal, and practice round inclusive package at an unbeatable rate. Apply for an invitation at www.dixieamateur.com.

notes:
36-hole four-ball stroke play (better-ball-of-partners) 
over two days. There will be a Championship Division

percent of the team total handicap). Players must be 
Members of AGA/GAP clubs in good standing.

title: Men’s Coal Scuttle Championship
notes:
Two-day team competition played at two courses, with

clubs in good standing.

notes:
This tournament is open to female amateur golfers who 
are members of member clubs of the MSGA having a

be an 18-hole four-ball stroke play competition in

title: St. Augustine Amateur 2020
notes:
The St. Augustine Amateur is a national event established in 2004 for top amateur and collegiate players. The 54-hole stroke play, walking only, competition is conducted over three days. The player caddies, walking referees, standard bearers and forecaddies really add to the experience. The field is limited to 78 players whose golf resumes and tournament experience have earned them a spot in the field. The winner receives the John C. Jennison III Trophy. The field is limited to 84 players, with no cut.

The tournament is open to Amateurs only whose entry has been accepted by the Tournament Committee however there is an open qualifier prior to the event.

title: Fall Central Oregon Shootout
notes:
This four-person team event (day 1 best-ball, day 2 
shamble; 1 Gross, 2 Nets, 80% of Individual Handicap) 
treats players to a tour of 
Central Oregon golf with a round-robin, two-course 
weekend featuring Eagle Crest and Black 
Butte Ranch. Payouts awarded each day in six 
divisions.
courseName: Black Butte Ranch Golf Club - Big Meadow

title: Carmody Invitational
notes:
Formerly known as the Merit Amateur, this is a two day, multi-format event 
that features rounds of 
best-ball Stableford. 27 holes are played each day, 
with 
the final 9 holes each day the aggregate score of the 
two players.
Handicap and age requirements are the same as for 
the
USGA 
Mid-Am and the USGA Senior Am. Field limit to 36 
teams and will be considered by playing 
resume. Merit Club hosted the 2000 U.S. 
Women's Open.

title: Pacific Northwest Four-Ball Championship
notes:
New in 2020, this is a 54-hole flighted two-man four-

Championship with consist of 72 teams, 144 players 
total. Championship Flight and Secondary Flight will be 
based on the field when registration closes. Each player 
must have a USGA Handicap Index below 20.0. Each 
player must be at least 16 years of age by the day of 
Championship.

title: The Natchez Open
notes:
New in 2020, this is a 54-hole stroke play tournament 
for pros and amateurs, with multiple amateur flights 
including senior (ages 50+) and super senior (ages 
60+) flights.

title: GCAA Amateur Series - Frankenmuth
notes:
Eligibility : Tournaments are open to any male or female golfers who were on a college or university varsity golf roster during the 2019-20 school year or will be on a college or university varsity golf roster during the upcoming 2020-21 school year.

Entry Fee: $265 per player – Tournament registration will open approximately six weeks prior to the date of the event and will be administered by the GCAA. Entry fee will include all competitive rounds, range access during the tournament days, as well as a boxed lunch between rounds on day one of the tournament.

Format: Events will be held over two day (Saturday- Sunday) 54 holes; using either a shotgun start format or double tee start format. Both male and female golfers will be competing in one tournament using two sets of tees. Tournaments will be recognized by WAGR; points will be awarded accordingly based on the individual participants finish against other players of their gender.

Practice Rounds: Will be optional and be at the expense of participants. The GCAA will work with host venues to set up day(s) and times for individuals who would like to play in a practice round. Participants will be responsible for setting up their own practice round.

Field Size: Events will have a minimum of 60 and a maximum of 84 players.

Format: Events will be held over two day (Saturday- Sunday) 54 holes; using either a shotgun start format or double tee start format. Both male and female golfers will be competing in one tournament using two sets of tees. Tournaments will be recognized by WAGR; points will be awarded accordingly based on the individual participants finish against other players of their gender.

Practice Rounds: Will be optional and be at the expense of participants. The GCAA will work with host venues to set up day(s) and times for individuals who would like to play in a practice round. Participants will be responsible for setting up their own practice round.

Field Size: Events will have a minimum of 60 and a maximum of 84 players.

title: Maridoe Amateur Championship
notes:
Introduced in 2020 to provide top-ranked players a 
chance to contend for a Walker Cup berth, this is a U.S. 
Amateur-style competition with 54 holes 
of stroke play followed by a 64-player match-play 
bracket and a 36-hole championship match. The top 
102 players in the World Amateur Golf Ranking (WAGR) 
will be invited, with the rest of the field based off the 
rankings.

Foundation 
Florida State Golf Association membership level is

approximately 
6,400 yards. Super-Senior approximately 6,100 
yards.

title: College Am Golf Kickoff
notes:
College Am Golf is a College Amateur Golf Series 
launched in September of 2020. 
The tournament series is ideal for College golfers 
who want to sharpen their skills 
and compete in WAGR-ranked events (though each 
event is open to golfers of all ages). Each event will 
host 84 players in major 
markets across the US and events have been 
selected based on geographical 
location and ease of travel. All College Am Golf 
(CAG) events will be 54 holes of 
stroke play competition open to Men and Women.

playing opportunities across Texas, mostly for

(i) all male golfers who maintain an active World 
Handicap System (WHS) handicap of 6.4 or less 
through a TGA member club and (ii) all female 
golfers who maintain a 12.4 or less. Each division 
will be comprised of at least 2/3 players that are 24 
and under. The remaining 1/3 of golfers will be 
comprised of players that are 25 and older.

comprised of players that are 25 and older.

title: Bayonet Black Horse Fall Invitational
notes:
36-hole stroke play tournament hosted at the 
always-tough Bayonet course at Bayonet Black 
Horse in Seaside, California. Men's and women's 
divisions. Open to amateur golfers 
with an official and verified handicap index not 
exceeding 7.4.

title: Virginia Net Amateur Championship
notes:
36-hole net stroke play competition (18 holes per day) open to VSGA members of all ages. The championship will be divided into the following divisions:

Men Ages 49 & under – All players will play from approximately 6,200-6,400 yards

Men Ages 50-64 – All players will play from approximately 5,900-6,100 yards

Men Ages 65 & Over – All players will play from approximately 5,600-5,800 yards

Women of all ages – Women ages 49 & under that have a Handicap Index of 9.9 or lower will play from approximately 5,600-5,800 yards. All other women will play from approximately 5,200 yards.
